title: Administrative Internship
description:
**About us;**

ShopFunder is a leading commercial business loan provider in New York, NY and a trusted partner with a wide range of mortgage products and services. ShopFunder is a fast-growing, diversified, and privately owned company that is focused on providing the highest quality of service to our customers. We are looking for Students for our Internship Program who are passionate about the small business owner industry and have a desire to grow within the company. The successful candidate will be able to provide high-quality customer service while maintaining a positive attitude in a team environment.

**Job Responsibilities:**  
·Work closely with clients to understand their needs and goals.  
·Provide support and assistance to clients as needed.  
·Effectively manage salespeople while overseeing business loans with merchants from application to close

title: Bookeeper
description:
Job Overview:

The Bookkeeper is a strategic thought-partner, who reports to the Owner . The successful candidate will be a hands-on and participative team member in the following areas: accounting/finance, business planning and budgeting, payroll, accounts receivable, accounts payable, building maintenance, IT liaison, and office administration.

The bookkeeper plays a critical role in partnering with the senior leadership team in strategic decision making and operations as Austin Care Pharmacy continues to enhance its quality programming and build capacity. This is a tremendous opportunity for a finance and operations leader to maximize and strengthen the internal capacity of a well-respected, high-impact organization.

Responsibilities:

* Day to Day accounting responsibilities for accounts receivable, accounts payable, account reconciliation, bi-weekly invoicing, managing petty cash & company credit card transactions, etc.
* Responsible for processing bi-weekly / weekly payroll, preparing all reports, updating the payroll system with any changes required.
* Coordinates facility maintenance for the site, reviews security footage, and handles office administration (supply orders, event planning, updating records, etc.)
* Prepare, analyze and present financial reports in an accurate and timely manner; clearly communicate monthly and annual financial statements; collate financial reporting materials for all donor segments, and oversee all financial, project/program and grants accounting.
* Coordinate the annual audit process, liaise with external auditors and the finance committee of the board of directors; assess any changes necessary.
* Assist with the annual budgeting and planning process in conjunction with the owner; administer and review all financial plans and budgets; monitor progress and changes and keep senior leadership team abreast of the organization’s financial status.
* Oversee the organizational cash flow and forecasting and notify senior leader of concerns.
* Manager vendor contracts and financial management/ reporting system; ensure that the contract billing and collection schedule is adhered to and that financial data and cash flow are steady and support operational requirements.
* Recommend updates of any necessary business policies and accounting practices
* Effectively communicate and present the critical financial matters to the board of directors.
* Complies with federal, state, and local legal requirements by understanding requirements, ensuring adherence to requirements, filing reports, and advising management of actions needed.

Requirements:

* Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or related field.
* At least 2-3 years of overall professional experience; ideally 4 years of broad financial and operations experience preferred.
* Must have intermediate excel skill level.
* Must have experience with QuickBooks Online.
* Ability to translate financial concepts to – and to effectively collaborate with -programmatic and fundraising colleagues who do not necessarily have finance backgrounds.
* Technology savvy with experience selecting and overseeing software installations and managing relationships with software vendors; knowledge of accounting and reporting software
* Commitment to training programs that maximize individual and organization goals across the organization.
* A successful track record in setting priorities; keen analytic, organization and problem solving skills which support and enable sound decision making
* Excellent communication and relationship building skills with an ability to prioritize, negotiate, and work with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
* The ideal candidate has experience of responsibility for the quality and content of all financial data, reporting and audit coordination for either a non-profit organization or a significant program area of a large non-profit.
* A multi-tasker with the ability to wear many hats in a fast-paced environment.
* Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and dedication to the mission of Austin Care Pharmacy.

If you possess these qualifications and are looking to contribute your expertise in a collaborative environment, we invite you to apply for this exciting Bookkeeper position.

title: Social Services Director
description:
**Position Title: Director of Social Services Reports To: Program Director**   
**Department: Social Services** **Employment Status: Full-Time**  
**FLSA Status: Exempt** **Position Status: Essential** 

**GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION** 

The Director of Social Services will be responsible for overseeing the daily operations of the Social Services  
Department. They will also serve as a liaison for overseeing a staff of Case Managers, Client Care Coordinators,  
Housing Specialists, Certified Alcohol and Substance Abuse Counselors, Employment Specialist, Residential  
Aides, Justice Coordinators, and Recreation Coordinators.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBLITIES** 

* Ensure all new clients receive social service intakes within 48 hours of assignment to case manager.
* Monitor and track client intakes and move outs utilizing client rosters.
* Oversee case manager supervisors and ensuring all case files are up to date.
* Communicate with peers in other programs on issues related to client progress
* Teach and coach all staff in regards to how interact with clients
* Conduct weekly staff meetings
* Review all signature sheets such as nightly roster and sign in sign out sheets
* Communicate with other Directors of the facility to make sure team work is involved
* Is on call 24 hours a day/seven days a week in case of emergencies.
* Intervene and review all client complaints
* Oversees all clinical services including programming, staff supervision, client/ staff interviewing, and case files.
* Make sure all independent living plans are completed in a timely manner
* Complete performance evaluations in conjunction with Program Director
* In the event of an emergency, Essential Employees are required to report to work as scheduled
* Duties and responsibilities are subject to change based upon company assessment of needs

**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS** 

* Bachelor’s Degree in Social Services
* Master’s Degree is preferred
* Must have at least 5 years work experience within a Social Services setting
* Extensive experience working with the homeless population, specifically families with children is preferred
* Must be motivated, energetic, punctual, responsible, and exhibit a positive attitude to be an excellent role model for clients and staff members
* Must be an assertive and confident individual with the ability to lead
* Must be able to confidently and efficiently communicate (verbally and in writing)
* Previous Program experience with program directing and DHS Cares is a plus

title: Regional Manager (Banking)
description:
**Company Description**  

First Financial Federal Credit Union is a not-for-profit financial cooperative providing banking products and services to its members in Monmouth and Ocean County. Our goal is make a first rate difference in our Member’s lives by providing the highest level of quality products and personalized services while maintaining financial integrity and stability. We have been putting people first and enriching our Member’s lives since 1936 by identifying their needs and providing trustworthy and value added solutions.


First Financial Federal Credit Union is a technology driven organization with efficient systems and easy to deliver products. We are par with community banks and can provide you with the kind of environment where your skills and talents can make a difference that will be noticed.

 **Job Description**  

Summary:  

Contribute to the management of the Credit Union's operations, growth and direction. Has the overall responsibility for the efficient and effective management of the Member Service and Delivery Channels. Ensures that established policies and procedures are adhered to and that members are served promptly and professionally. Responsible for building branch business by developing and implementing programs to attract new business and retain existing business. Responsible for increasing our penetration with existing business partners

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:**

* Responsible for managing 3 branches
* Develop strategic plan, policies and procedures to help the Credit Union grow
* Ensure the success of plans and policies through effective implementation at the branch level
* Ensure compliance with Bank Secrecy Act and all federal regulations as set forth by the NCUA and other regulatory agencies
* Responsible for Member Service, respond to questions, resolving issues and member education on product and services
* Coach staff to evaluate needs of the member and offer appropriate financial products and services
* Work with the Lending Department Director and team to ensure the lending goals are achieved.
* Work with Branch Managers to ensure that the Branches goals are achieved.
* Provide senior management with feedback on member satisfaction, member needs, product and services for use in product development and for strategic planning.
* Prepare for monthly auditors and year end comprehensive audits for all branches
* Develop new business relationships and maintain current membership through support and management of an effective consultative sales and service culture
* Ensure the success of plans, policies and procedures through effective support of electronic delivery services:
	+ - Online Banking
		- Mobile Banking
		- Remote Deposit Capture
		- Bill Pay
		- Person-to-Person Payment
* Work with our Investment and Retirement Center

 **Qualifications**  

* College degree in Finance/Business Administration or equivalent experience
* 5-7 years related experience and/or training
* Ability to successfully complete all regulatory compliance courses (i.e. BSA)
* Proven track record in successful implementation of consultative sales and service culture.
* Ability to recognize and solve problems.
* Cost Consciousness - Develops and implements cost saving measures
* Strategic Thinking - Develops strategies to achieve organizational goals.
* Ability to analyze, and interpret business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, governmental regulations, financial reports and legal documents.
* Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, employees and members.
* Good presentation skills
* Ability to read balance sheets and calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, and proportions.
* Strong knowledge of computers

  

**Additional Information**  

As a First Financial employee, you'll enjoy a challenging work environment. Our benefit package includes Medical, Dental, Rx, Vision, Life Insurance, 401K Plan, Pension Plan, Vacation, Sick and Personal time.


Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

title: Seasonal Delivery Driver (October – March)
description:
**\\*\\*\\* PLEASE DO NOT CALL OUR OFFICE DIRECTLY \\*\\*\\***

**Casey Energy** is a family-owned company that has proudly served Ridgefield's residents and businesses for over 75 years. Our reputation is founded on our commitment to go above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction, delivering honest and ethical service at every turn.


Currently, we have an immediate opening for a **Seasonal Delivery Driver (October - March)** who will be responsible for safely transporting and delivering heating oil to residential and commercial customers in the Ridgefield, Danbury, and New Milford areas, ensuring timely and efficient service. This person will also operate a company vehicle, maintain accurate delivery records, and provide exceptional customer service while adhering to all safety and regulatory requirements standards.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive pay
* Paid holidays and 3 weeks of PTO
* Medical and dental insurance - 70% employer contribution
* Long-term and short-term disability - 70% employer contribution
* 401k with a 3% match
* Company vehicle
* Uniforms provided
* Professional development
* Employee appreciation events

**Pay rate:** $20.00 to $40.00 per hour, dependent upon experience

**Work Hours:** Monday through Friday, 7:30 am - 4:00 pm, some overtime as needed

**Required Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Valid commercial driver's license (CDL) with hazardous materials (Hazmat) and tanker endorsements
* Clean driving record with no major violations
* Ability to safely operate and maneuver delivery trucks in various weather conditions
* Excellent knowledge of local roads and routes in the area
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy in recording delivery transactions
* Ability to lift and carry heavy loads, including loading and unloading fuel tanks
* Commitment to safety protocols and procedures
* Good communication and interpersonal skills for interacting with customers

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience as a delivery driver in the fuel oil industry
* Familiarity with heating oil delivery equipment and procedures
* Knowledge of fuel oil storage tanks, gauges, and safety devices
* Mechanical aptitude for performing basic maintenance and inspections on delivery vehicles
* Understanding of environmental regulations related to fuel handling and spill prevention
* Customer service training or experience in a client-facing role
* Willingness to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends, as needed

**Candidates will be required to pass a background check and drug test upon being given a conditional offer of employment**

title: Customer Service Rep
description:
**About us**

**PROVIDING PREMIER LAUNDRY SOLUTIONS SINCE 1952**

For three generations, Fowler has provided exceptional laundry solutions with a personal touch found only in a family-owned business. Since its founding in 1952, Fowler has grown into a multi-state corporation with customers on both coasts. We are a challenging, fast-paced, professional team and we want candidates to Join our expanding and exciting Company. We are a fast growing Commercial Coin/Card Operated Laundry Route Operator, with our headquarters in Union, NJ. We service the majority of the East coast, and rapidly going national.

If you are an exceptional employee, looking for a great place to work, then come join our team!

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Customer Service Representative to join our busy call center team. As a key member of our customer service department, you will be responsible for handling inbound and outbound calls, addressing customer inquiries, processing orders, and ensuring an exceptional customer experience. This role requires strong communication skills, the ability to multitask, and a commitment to providing high-quality service in a fast-paced environment.

**Customer service representative duties:**

* Open and maintain customer accounts by recording account information
* Resolve product or service problems by clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause of the problem; selecting and explaining the best solution to solve the problem; expediting correction or adjustment; following up to ensure resolution

* Manage large amounts of incoming calls
* Generate sales leads
* Identify and assess customers' needs to achieve satisfaction
* Build sustainable relationships of trust through open and interactive communication

* Use telephones to reach out to customers and verify account information
* Greet customers warmly and ascertain problem or reason for calling
* Advise on company information
* Take payment information and other pertinent information such as addresses and phone numbers
* Work with customer service manager to ensure proper customer service is being delivered

title: Service Advisor
description:
Are you passionate about providing exceptional customer service and making a meaningful impact in the community? **Hendrickson Fire Rescue Equipment** is seeking a dedicated and driven **full-time Service Advisor** to join us in Congers, NY. This exciting opportunity comes with a competitive compensation package, offering a salary range of **$55,000 to $65,000, plus bonuses** and an array of attractive benefits, including PTO, health, dental, life, and vision insurance, short- and long-term disability coverage, HSA/FSA options, a 401(k) with matching contribution, bonus incentives, growth opportunities, and even company parties and uniforms. If you're ready to showcase your expertise and grow your career in a supportive and rewarding environment, apply today to become our Service Advisor!

 **WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT OUR FAMILY-ORIENTED BUSINESS?**


For over four decades, Hendrickson Fire Rescue Equipment has been a reliable partner for Long Island and beyond. Specializing in top-tier fire apparatus and ambulance products and services, we take pride in being an industry leader. Our dedicated team offers unparalleled support to customers, ensuring they have all the tools and resources they need to keep their community safe. Being part of the Hendrickson team means joining a close-knit family of skilled individuals who work together to overcome challenges and exceed targets. Join us and gear up for a rewarding career!

 **DO YOU MEET THESE QUALIFICATIONS?**

* Valid driver's license
* High School or equivalent education
* 3+ years of dealership experience
* Previous customer service experience
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Good organizational and time management skills
* Basic understanding of automotive parts and mechanical systems
* Good listening skills and willingness to listen throughout the whole repair process
* Ability to maintain a professional attitude, conduct, and appearance
* Ability to use a computer and point-of-sale
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds regularly
* Experience with fire and emergency apparatus, experience invoicing customers, and experience or certification with specific manufacturers are bonuses!
* 2+ years as a Service Advisor would be preferable.

 **WHAT WILL YOU DO AS A SERVICE ADVISOR?**


As a Service Advisor at Hendrickson Fire Rescue Equipment, you will be responsible for setting up service appointments that fit with both the customer and technicians' schedules. You will also act as a liaison between the service manager, parts personnel, and technicians, as well as supporting dealership goals for service through high sales of services and parts. Your role will involve managing the intake of vehicles to ensure accurate identification and verification of service needs, as well as maintaining customer relationships by explaining estimates and obtaining approvals. In addition, you will work with vendors to submit and resolve warranty claims. Your communication skills, problem-solving abilities, and dedication to customer satisfaction will make a positive impact on the team and customers.

 **READY TO APPLY AND ADVANCE YOUR CAREER?**


If you think this Service Advisor job at Hendrickson Fire Rescue Equipment is a fit for what you are looking for, applying is a snap - just follow the instructions on this page. We value your time, so we won't ask you to fill out a long, drawn-out application. This initial application should take you less than 3 minutes to complete. Good luck!

title: Community Support Specialist
description:
Hope For Youth has openings for a Community Psychiatric Supports and Treatment (CPST) Worker in our CFTSS Department. Hope For Youth is a nonprofit organization specializing in child welfare services. For over 50 years, Hope For Youth strives to provide positive outcomes for children, adolescents, and families. A CPST Worker would assist children and their families achieve stability in their home, set goals, and create interpersonal relationships. This person would also provide crisis management and counseling. This position is part time with flexible hours based on the needs of the program and clients.


Community Psychiatric Support and Treatment (CPST) services are goal-directed supports and solution-focused interventions intended to address challenges associated with a behavioral health need and to achieve identified goals or objectives as set forth in the child's treatment plan. CPST services include the activities necessary to correct or ameliorate conditions discovered during the initial assessment visits. CPST is a face to face intervention with the child/youth, family/caregiver or other collateral supports. This is a multi-component service that consists of therapeutic interventions such as counseling, as well as function OLP, to address identified rehabilitative needs with a comprehensive treatment plan. Services are delivered in a trauma informed, culturally and linguistically competent manner.


How you will spend your time in this job:

* 70% Direct client therapeutic contact including transportation
* 20% Case documentation, reports, case related meetings
* 10% Staff meetings/supervision/training


Minimum Qualifications:


1. Must have a Bachelor's Degree or higher


2. 1 year of experience working with children/adolescents and families


3. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required


4. Valid NYS Driver's License in good standing


5. Demonstrated computer literacy including Microsoft Office and electronic medical record system, upon hire, 10e11.


6. Physical Requirements: Operate a motor vehicle carrying up to ten (10) children and youth, lift/move up to fifty (50) pounds, escort children and youth into the community using stairs when necessary, restrain a child or youth during a crisis, read/write reports and log entries, walking/standing for prolonged periods, bending/stooping, kneeling/squatting, climbing stairs, reaching overhead, repetitive wrist/finger movements, driving own vehicle


Please include resume, cover letter and salary requirements. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


All positions are subject to background screening as required by law or contract, including but not limited to: Staff Exclusion List (SEL), State Central Child Abuse Registry (SCR), DMV record review, criminal records screening, reference checks, for some roles, a physical exam. Hope For Youth is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


Excellent training and leadership opportunities available throughout employment and more.

**Here are some of the other benefits of working for Hope For Youth.**

* **Meaningful work** that makes a difference in the lives of children and families of Long Island!
* **Supportive** like-minded, **mission-driven** co-workers
* Diverse **Culture** **that** **promotes** **recognition and belonging**
* **Advancement** and **supplemental** **pay** opportunities
* **Free** T**raining** programs, F**ree Tuition Credits, Scholarships** **and** **Tuition Assistance**
* Employees may be eligible for **Student Loan Forgiveness Programs**
* **Special Events** and **Recognition Awards**
* **Volunteer** and **Internship** **opportunities** available within
* Benefit eligibility commences on the first of the month following the first 30 days of employment
* **90% Employer-paid medical premiums**
* **Generous** **paid time off**
* **Agency-funded Pension Plan**
* Pre-tax savings plans: self-directed **403(b), 529, FSA** and **HSA** Accounts
* **Agency-paid life insurance and disability**, and for some positions, long-term disability


Learn more about Hope For Youth at: http://www.hfyny.org

**Additional Pay Range Information**

title: Front Desk Coordinator (Chinese Bilingual)
description:
**Job Purpose**

Manage the receptionist role at the entrance and coordinate security responsibilities.

**Responsibilities**

* Greets visitors, investigates visitor clearance, issues temporary badges to cleared visitors, and maintains visitor log.
* Routes Participant issues to the appropriate department. Refer complaints to the A&G department promptly.
* Ensure employees, upon entry, are wearing their id badge.
* Answers and correctly routes phone calls. Responds to basic inquiries.
* Sends phone call messages via email to staff.
* Receives, distributes, and sends mail including packages.
* Pages staff when they are needed at the front desk. Overhead paging emergency announcements.
* Makes periodic tours of the grounds examining possible points of entrance to make sure they are properly secured.
* Monitors security camera.
* Maintains order and safety of personnel in the event of an emergency.
* Ensure proper usage of parking for sites that have their own parking facility.
* Cover lunch breaks of the Transportation Coordinator role.
* Backup the Transportation Coordinator with basic calls as needed.
* Support other sites within the same region as needed.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Performance Standards**

* Performs consistently with the organization’s mission and philosophy.
* Performs job responsibilities according to the organization’s policies. Seeks clarification when needed.
* Assumes responsibility for assignments given, seeks supervision appropriately, and is accountable for work performance. Meets productivity guidelines.
* Maintains proper documentation (updated, timely, legible) related to patient care, whether paper or electronic.
* Maintains HIPAA standards and confidentiality of PHI.
* Supports staff, student, and volunteer orientation and ongoing in-service education as requested.
* Supports organizational activities by participating in quality improvement activities, special projects, internal and/or external committees, community activities, and other duties as assigned.
* Serves as a role model for peers and colleagues.
* Assumes responsibility for professional growth and development; maintains and upgrades professional knowledge and practice skills.
* Treats other CenterLight employees respectfully and facilitates an environment of teamwork.
* Initiates, if appropriate, incident reporting process, and participates in incident investigation and reporting as applicable.
* Performs general office duties in connection with job responsibilities, including but not limited to photocopies, faxing, typing, filing, and phone calls.

**Service Standards**

* Makes the needs of participants their central focus, and finds innovative ways to provide an exceptional experience.
* Develops and maintains positive “customer” relationships (“customer” is defined as co-workers, participants, visitors, vendors, supervisors).
* Communicates with customers in a caring, helpful, considerate, and culturally sensitive manner.
* Demonstrates a thorough understanding of customer needs and wants and attempts to anticipate and meet customer needs.
* Suggests and implements customer-centered service improvements.
* Encourages customers to engage with CenterLight employees and CenterLight activities.
* Utilizes service recovery techniques to resolve issues quickly and to the customer’s satisfaction. Immediately reports customer dissatisfaction to IDT for follow-up.

**Weekly Hours:** 40

**Schedule:** 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM

**Job Qualifications**

**Education:** High school diploma or GED

**Experience:** Some receptionist and/or security guard experience preferred

**License Registration:** N/A

**Language:** Bilingual. Language requirements will vary depending of each site's predominant language of the participants.

**Physical:** Ability to lift packages up to 25 pounds

**Other:** Demonstrate proficient typewriting skills. Typewriting test must be taken with a minimum of 40 – 45 words per minute preferably, and over 90% of accuracy.

**Physical Requirements**

Individuals must be able to sustain certain physical requirements essential to the job. This includes, but is not limited to:

* **Standing** – Duration of up to 6 hours a day.
* **Sitting/Stationary Positions** – Sedentary position in duration of up to 6-8 hours a day for consecutive hours/periods.
* **Lifting/Push/Pull** – Up to 50 pounds of equipment, baggage, supplies, and other items used in the scope of the job using OSHA guidelines, etc.
* **Bending/Squatting** – Have to be able to safely bend or squat to perform the essential functions under the scope of the job.
* **Stairs/Steps/Walking/Climbing** – Must be able to safely maneuver stairs, climb up/down, and walk to access work areas.
* **Agility/Fine Motor Skills** - Must demonstrate agility and fine motor skills to operate and activate equipment, devices, instruments, and tools to complete essential job functions (ie. typing, use of supplies, equipment, etc.)
* **Sight/Visual Requirements** – Must be able to visually read documentation, papers, orders, signs, etc., and type/write documentation, etc. with accuracy.
* **Audio Hearing and Motor Skills (Language) Requirements** – Must be able to listen attentively and document information from patients, community members, co-workers, clients, providers, etc., and intake information through audio processing with accuracy. In addition, they must be able to speak comfortably and clearly with language motor skills for customers to understand the individual.
* **Cognitive Ability** – Must be able to demonstrate good decision-making, reasonableness, cognitive ability, rational processing, and analysis to satisfy essential functions of the job.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Infusion Nurse (RN)
description:
**Position:** Infusion Nurse

  

Location: Annandale, NJ

  

Schedule: 4 days per week; 8- 9 hour shifts


Week1: Monday - Thursday
  

Week 2: Mon, Wednesday, Thurs, and Friday
  

Hours: Full Time (32-36hrs a week), No Weekends
  

Benefits: PTO, Medical, Vision, Dental, etc

 **Job Description:**
  

OI Infusion Services offers a complete solution to managing in-office infusion centers. Our proven model provides practice owners with everything they need to start and maintain an infusion center, resulting in increased revenue and higher patient satisfaction. Our management services are designed to let physicians focus on practicing medicine while our highly experienced staff manages every aspect of this value-added service in a professional manner at every point of contact. We are looking for a dedicated infusion nurse who is excited to serve as a cornerstone of our infusion suite at Hunterdon Neurology.

 **Qualifications/Educational Requirements:**

* Registered nurse (R.N.) with a current license within the state.
* Minimum of one year of Infusion/IV experience as an R.N.
* Work positively and favorably with patients, families, and staff.
* Infusion experience highly preferred

**Responsibilities:**

The person in this position must be able to perform the following essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation.

* Perform the infusion therapy as directed by physician orders.
* Establish intravenous access per policy and procedure.
* Observe, assess, and document symptoms via nurses note timely.
* Monitor reactions and patient progress.
* Educate patients and/or caregivers on disease process, medications
* Demonstrates proper infection control techniques and follows universal precautions
* Monitors daily refrigerator temperatures and documents daily log.
* Schedule follow up appointment for next therapy.
* Notify the physician and other personnel (Regional Operations Director) of change in the patient's condition.
* Perform skills outlined in approved policy and procedure manual.
* Update clinical records according to policy and procedures.
* Update knowledge and skills by attending in-service programs, continuing education programs, seminars, and self-study programs annually.
* Adhere to safe nursing practice standards.
* Maintain professionalism with patient and client staff.
* Obtain satisfaction survey from patients.
* Collect co-pays as required.
* Call no-show patients to schedule.
company_description: OI Infusion partners with specialist providers to open infusion centers, grow their practices, lower costs and deliver better patient outcomes.

title: RN-Wound Care Nurse-Home Care-Manhattan
company: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation
description:
**RN-Wound Care Nurse**

**Certified Home Health Agency**

  

Parker Jewish Institute is seeking **Full Time Wound Care Nurses** to join Parker's Certified Home Health Agency (CHHA).

 *Now conducting visits in Manhattan*

  

Parker Jewish Institute Hospice and Home Health Care offers the finest in home health and hospice services from an interdisciplinary team of health care professionals. Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation is a faith-based, not-for-profit health care system comprised of multiple health services servicing the Metropolitan New York Area, including Long Island, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx, Manhattan and Westchester.

  

The Wound Care RN at Parker Jewish Institute's Certified Home Health Agency is responsible for establishing standards of care for patients, providing wound care nursing service in the patient's home including wound vac, assuring compliance based on current regulations, and promoting community health through teaching, counseling, and providing direct patient care. This position is conducting visits in Manhattan.

  

This is an excellent clinical opportunity for nurses interested in a community health role and are looking to grow their clinical experience with an innovative organization among committed professionals. Parker Jewish Institute's Certified Home Health Agency offers a professional environment with benefits including clustered patient caseloads, independent and flexible scheduling, and extensive training, education, and growth opportunities, along with competitive salaries, stable work schedules, and excellent benefits to include health, dental, vision, 401(k), free parking and more.

 **About Parker**


The Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation, conveniently located on the Queens-Nassau County border in New Hyde Park, New York, is a non-profit health care facility that offers inpatient programs such as sub-acute/short term rehabilitation, long-term care and nursing home care, as well as community health services encompassing certified home health care and a comprehensive community hospice program that serves terminally ill patients in their own homes or in nursing facilities, including Parker's nursing home.


Quality care means hiring quality people, and Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation has a longstanding reputation for excellence and innovation in resident and patient care.

 **Why Work at Parker**

* Friendly, collaborative team environment and exciting career growth opportunities providing an opportunity to learn, grow and have an impact on the overall results
* Excellent training and clinical education
* Accessible via public transportation
* Free parking on site for all staff
* On-site cafeteria offering breakfast and lunch
* Full Benefits for Full Time and Part Time staff include Health Insurance, 401k, Vacation, Holiday and Sick Time

 **Position Requirements**

* Current New York State license as a Registered Nurse (RN)
* Certified in Wound Care
* Experience with Wound Vac in Home Health Care
* Prior Community RN or Home Health RN experience a plus
* Access to reliable transportation a must-available to travel to and within Manhattan
* Tech savvy, with proficiency in AllScripts or another electronic medical record (EMR)
* Fully vaccinated against COVID-19

title: Ice Rink Staffing + Hospitality Manager
description:
Domino Park is a world class 6-acre park located along the Williamsburg waterfront in Brooklyn, NY. The park, designed by Two Trees Management and James Corner Field Operations (JCFO), spans a quarter mile from Grand Street to South 5th Street. It contains a variety of passive and active recreational programming, diverse plantings and landscape features, as well as several distinctive large artifacts from the site’s industrial history as a sugar refinery.

Domino Square, a 1-acre addition to the park, will open to the public in September 2024 and will feature a 7,100 square foot, outdoor, seasonal ice-skating rink every November to March.

Domino Park Conservancy is seeking an experienced Ice Rink Staffing + Hospitality Manager to lead the front-of-house team responsible for operating the Domino Square Ice Rink.

**Responsibilities**

- Act in a general oversight capacity and direct the day-to-day operations of the Domino Square Ice Rink.

- Manage the recruitment and direct the hiring of all seasonal front-of-house personnel positions, including on-ice Skate Hosts and on-site customer service personnel.

- Implement a hospitality-forward customer service training program with the objective of ensuring all customers have a great experience.

- Create a positive work environment and encourage staff to complete assigned responsibilities efficiently, effectively, and with a focused attention to detail.

- Accurately complete all daily operational reporting in a timely manner, such as end-of-day reports, incident reports, and facility reports.

**Work Location + Hours**

- This position is a temporary / seasonal role expected to start in September of 2024 and conclude in March / April of 2025.

- Based on ice rink visitorship, the position will require work at varied (but pre-scheduled) hours/days, including nights, weekends, and holidays.

- Ongoing consideration will be given to ensure a positive work experience and an ample work-life balance, including opportunity for “comp” days.

**Qualifications**

- Past experience in a similar position

- Hardworking, energetic, self-motivated, and dedicated to the details

- Ability to work in a fast-paced, start-up environment

- Strong communication skills and ability to convey the mission and goals of the park

- Comfortable working independently or with a team and outside in a park-setting

**Salary + Benefits**

- Salary: $1,500 - $2,000 per week, paid weekly.

**About Two Trees**

- Two Trees Management Company is a family-owned, Brooklyn-based real estate development firm best known for its singular role in transforming DUMBO from a neglected, industrial waterfront into a vibrant, mixed-use community, as well as the on-going creation of the Domino campus on the Williamsburg waterfront. Our fundamental belief that successful neighborhoods offer a wide variety of uses and attract diverse groups of people, and that developers must play a fundamental role in cultivating livable streetscapes - because people prosper when neighborhoods bloom. In addition to the residential and commercial buildings across DUMBO, Williamsburg, Fort Greene, Brooklyn Heights, Hell’s Kitchen and Flatiron neighborhoods, other notable projects include Domino Park, The Plaza at 300 Ashland, The Refinery at Domino, River Ring, The Wythe Hotel and Jane’s Carousel.

**To Apply**

- Please submit your cover letter and resume via email to Michael Lampariello, Director of Domino Park at jobs@dominopark.com.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Pay: $1,500.00 - $2,000.00 per week

Work Location: In person

title: Entry-Level Bilingual Human Resources Assistant
description:
Tempco Glass Fabrication, LLC is an MBE-certified, family-owned glass fabricator located in Flushing, Queens. We specialize in cutting-edge glass fabrication while maintaining a customer-first approach and local charm. Our company is committed to sustainability and innovation, particularly through our production of energy-efficient low-e insulated glass units, which play a crucial role in decarbonization. At Tempco, we partner with a diverse range of clients, including glaziers, manufacturers, developers, and architects, to bring their visions to life. As a leader in green building components, we are at the forefront of advancing photovoltaic glass and vacuum insulated glass technologies to contribute to a sustainable future..

As the development of the company, demands for HR support increased dramatically. We are seeking for a qualified HR assistant to provide administrative support to our Human Resources department. Reporting to the HR manager, the assistant will help with payroll, recruiting, scheduling, benefits, and training tasks. The assistant will also act as the primary liaison between the department and other employees. Our employees are the foundation of our company, and we are committed to creating an environment where everyone can thrive. Our HR assistant will be a key part of ensuring employee success and will have room to grow their career.

**In this position, you’ll be responsible for:**

* Assist with recruiting tasks such as reviewing resumes, conducting and scheduling interviews, hiring, and following up with candidates
* Schedule and coordinate onboarding assignments and training sessions
* Compile and process employee documentation and records, and keep the employee database up to date
* Assist the HR manager with formulating policies, procedures, and changes, as well as communicating all updates to employees
* Maintain the departmental email account, responding to employee questions and complaints in a timely and professional manner
* Track employee attendance, PTO, and leaves, and assist with payroll processing and documentation

**Skills and qualifications:**

* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Strong attention to detail
* Proficiency in administrative duties such as communications, data entry, and record keeping
* Enthusiasm for working within a team environment
* Tact and professionalism when it comes to handling confidential information and addressing employee concerns
* Proficiency with technology, and the ability to pick up new software easily

**Preferred qualifications**:

* Familiarity with company’s preferred HR software, but not required
* HR background or knowledge preferred
* Experience in an administrative role
* Understanding of labor laws
* Desire to grow within the company
* Bilingual in English and Chinese or Spanish preferred

title: Driver
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a reliable Driver to join the Roof Shark team. We are a roofing contractor based out of Elmwood Park, NJ. We serve northern NJ. The successful candidate will be responsible for driving a company work van or company pick-up truck and completing deliveries efficiently. This role requires a strong commitment to safety, a keen sense of navigation, and the ability to lift heavy packages. The ideal candidate will have experience with manual transmission vehicles, commercial driving, and route driving.

Responsibilities:

- Operate a pick-up truck or work van for delivery and transportation purposes.  
- Load and unload construction materials safely and efficiently.  
- Drive safely and follow all traffic laws and regulations.  
- Plan and navigate routes to ensure timely and cost-effective delivery.  
- Lift and move heavy packages as needed.  
- Maintain a clean and organized vehicle, including the exterior and interior.  
- Keep records of delivery and any issues encountered during transport.  
- Provide excellent customer service and maintain a professional demeanor.

Skills:

- Proficiency in operating a manual transmission vehicle.  
- Experience with commercial driving and route driving.

title: Group Home Coordinator
description:
For over 40 years, Alternatives, Inc. has been dedicated to providing the best in support services to adults with Developmental/Intellectual Disabilities and Mental Illnesses. Services include Residential, Behavior Support, Support Coordination and Recreation. We have seen great growth in the past few years, which has stretched our coverage area to include Warren, Hunterdon, Morris, Union, Middlesex, Monmouth & Ocean counties. This expansion would not be possible without our dedicated staff members working on the front lines.


They make it their mission to ensure the comfort and safety of each client. They spend day-in and day-out focused on helping their clients succeed. They see them at their best and at their worst. Their relationship is one of mutual respect and admiration. Direct Support Professionals become clients' second family or, in some cases, only family.


Role of a Program Coordinator:

* Oversee two (2) residential programs in Somerville & Hillsborough, NJ
* Supervision of direct care staff
* Assist in activities of daily living skills
* Administer or assist with prescribed medication
* Provide transportation
* Assists in the implementation of individual plans for individuals and behavioral plan goals
* Assists individuals in the pursuit of recreational, social and community activities based on their preferences and individual plans
* Support people to achieve personal outcomes that characterize a high quality of life


Desired Qualities of a Group Home Coordinator:

* Positive Communication Skills
* Compassion
* Reliability & Dedication
* Desire to make a difference
* Ethical and moral values
* Professionalism


Qualifications:

* DDD Management experience REQUIRED
* Bachelors degree preferred; High School diploma or GED required
* Ability to pass criminal/registry background checks/drug screen
* Clear tuberculosis screening
* A valid driver's license, no more than 5 points or DUI in last 3 years
* Ability to pass and maintain required trainings such as CPR/First Aid, Medication Administration and Positive Behavioral Support Training

  

So why should you apply...? Here are just SOME of the incentives for being part of our team!

* Paid training
* Annual Longevity Increases
* Staff Appreciation events
* Health and Wellness fairs
* Lunch & Learns
* Employee Recognition Awards
* Student Loan Forgiveness Program
* Mileage reimbursement
* For a full list of benefits, click here


We invite you to apply and become part of the Alternatives team and make a difference!

***Change Lives, Build Futures!***

  

Program Coordinator


Full-Time


Somerville & Hillsborough Group Homes (GH 9 & GH 12)


Monday - Friday, flexible schedule


Tuition Reimbursement | Paid Time Off | 401K | Health Benefits  



  

$66,960/yr

  

BA & 3 Years Experience Preferred

*Experience may be substituted for education*

*Computer skills a must !*

  

Must possess valid NJ/NY/PA driver's license

*\\*\\*In order to be eligible for employment, applicant must not have more than 5 points on their driving record and no DUIs within the last 3 years.\\*\\**

  

Essential Duties & Responsibilities Include:

* Responsible for overall operation and management of assigned program.
* Work in conjunction with Director of Services in screening and selection of referrals to program.
* Design and implement Individual Service Plans for clients.
* Carry out IHP goals and Positive Support Plans designed by Behavior Analyst.
* Coordinate of medical services to clients, ensuring appropriate, effective and efficient interventions, appropriate documentation of medical services and follow-up.
* Demonstrate working knowledge of medical needs of clients and medical issues.
* Complete staff appraisals
* Ensure staff attend required trainings in the established time frame
* Supervise program staff including recommendation of hiring and termination, assignment of duties, instruction of methods, documentation of employees' progress, and collection and submission of time sheets and travel vouchers
* Ensure all program staff are appropriately trained and maintain program training records.
* Responsible for adherence to budgetary guidelines
* Responsible for monitoring and ensuring safe-keeping of funds including clients' monies and programs' petty cash fund and charges.
* Serve as liaison and responsible for fostering positive relationships between program and inter-agency departments, family members, neighbors, medical providers, day support programs/employers, DHS representatives, etc.
* Provision of appropriate community integration opportunities for clients
* Conduct monthly staff meeting
* Provides direct care support to clients receiving services in areas of, but not limited to, medical (diet and nutrition), daily living skills, money management, personal growth and development, vocational training, socialization, community integration, self preservation, community awareness and safety, and communication.
* Strong interpersonal & effective communication skills required

 *Alternatives, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*

title: Manufacturing Unit Leader - Forming
description:
**WHY DO WE NEED YOU?**  

The Manufacturing Unit Leader - Forming will oversee the forming manufacturing unit, ensuring the smooth operation and continuous improvement of processes, quality, and safety. This role is responsible for managing day-to-day activities and driving mid-to-long-term strategic improvements in the unit. The Manufacturing Unit Leader will report to the Zone Leader and will have direct reports, including production supervisors, leads, and process engineer. Additionally, the role includes dotted-line management of support functions such as Quality, Maintenance, Planning, Customer Service. Essential functions include: - Leadership & Management: Lead and manage the manufacturing unit to achieve production targets, ensuring optimal utilization of resources. Supervise and develop production supervisors, leads, and process engineers to foster a high-performance culture. Promote exemplary leadership and state-of-the-art EHS practices within the unit. Develop and coach his/her direct and indirect team, discuss career path, perform gap analysis and oversee training program to secure a successful employee journey and business performance. - Operational Excellence: Ensure day-to-day operations run efficiently across three shifts, five days a week. (Participate to PCS meetings) Implement and oversee continuous improvement initiatives, including World Class Manufacturing (WCM) projects, to enhance productivity and quality. Develop and optimize manufacturing processes, flows, and transactions. - Quality and Safety: Maintain high standards of product quality and adherence to safety regulations. Collaborate with Quality Engineers to implement quality control measures and ensure compliance with industry standards and Management systems. Drive a safety-first culture, ensuring all safety protocols and procedures are followed. - Strategic Planning and Development: Develop mid-to-long-term strategic plans to drive unit growth and efficiency. Identify opportunities for innovation and technological advancements within the manufacturing process. Collaborate with the Zone Leader to align unit objectives with organizational goals. Prepare operational plans and budgets and reports to appropriate Management on actual performance vs. plan.  

**WHAT ARE THE REQUIREMENTS?**  

Required Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Industrial, Mechanical, Chemical...) - Master's degree - 8+ years' experience working in a production/manufacturing environment - 5+ years' experience in a leadership role within a production/manufacturing environment managing, coaching and leading direct reports - 5+ years' experience in lean manufacturing, six sigma or WCM type methodologies - Strong communication and interpersonal skills - Proficient in ERP systems, Excel/PowerPoint and BI tools - Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities - Strong leadership and team management skills - Knowledge of Quality Management Systems / Certification environment - Experience managing and working with outside contractors and vendors to ensure the overall safety of the facility. - Knowledge of predictive and preventative maintenance to ensure efficient and safe operation of machinery and equipment - Understanding Basic Finance and cost structure / P&L - Continuous improvement methodologies (Incl. 5S, Kaizen, SMED…) Preferred Qualifications: - PMP Certification - Green Belt / Black Belt (6 Sigma or WCM)  

**IS THIS JOB FOR YOU?**  

Employees have the flexibility to choose the benefits that best fit their individual needs.  Health and Wellbeing – Supporting your wellbeing, to thrive in life and work. o Medical, Prescription Drug, Vision, and Dental Insurance o Healthcare Saving Account and Flexible Spending Account options o LiveWell Wellness Program o Employee Assistance Program (EAP) o Paid Time Off and Paid Parental Leave  Retirement and Protection - Helping to make the future life you want a reality. o 401(k) with Company Match, Retirement Accumulation Plan (RAP), Cash Balance Pension Plan o Company-provided Life Insurance, AD&D, Short-Term Disability o Voluntary employee and dependent life insurance, Long-Term Disability, Critical Illness and Accident Insurance  Additional Benefits – Helping shape the experience and impact you want o Commuter Benefits o Group Legal o Identity Theft Protection o Auto and Home Insurance o Pet Insurance and Discounts o Back-up Child & Elder Care  

**Legal Statement**  

Saint-Gobain provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Saint-Gobain is an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and supports the hiring of veterans.

title: Coordinator, Human Resources (Remote or Hybrid)
description:
**Who we are:**


The Council of State Governments Justice Center works across the country to develop research-driven strategies to increase public safety and strengthen communities. To further this mission, we work with partners inside and outside of government to reduce crime and incarceration among youth and adults in contact with the justice system. We bring people from diverse systems and perspectives together to improve policy and practice. And we transform data and research findings into meaningful insights for decision-makers.

  

We're focused on three strategic goals:

* Break the cycle of incarceration.
* Advance health, opportunity, and equity.
* Use data to improve safety and justice.

  

When you join the CSG Justice Center, you join an organization that is uniquely positioned to cultivate innovation and drive data-driven reform nationally. We have approximately 170 employees based in more than 30 states who have decades of experience working in and with criminal, juvenile, and Tribal justice agencies. We have provided housing, mental health, and addiction services; served as educators and in workforce development agencies; and supported victims and survivors of crime. We have served governors, state legislators, and members of Congress on both sides of the political spectrum. What binds us together is a shared commitment to our mission; to one another; to a common set of values; and to the national, bipartisan advisory board that guides our work.

  

Learn more about careers at the CSG Justice Center.

 **How you'll fit in:**

The Human Resources Coordinator is integral to the Human Resources team, ensuring seamless operations across critical functions. This position will provide essential administrative support across various HR domains, including HR systems management, staff training, recruitment, and meticulous employee record-keeping. Reporting directly to the Director of Human Resources and Talent Acquisition, this role requires an agile touch-balancing multiple responsibilities while maintaining impeccable organization and attention to detail.

 **What you'll do:**

  

Specific responsibilities of the human resources coordinator include the following:

* Learn and leverage company policies and practices.
* Become a well-versed user of human resources information and applicant tracking systems.
* Assist with onboarding and off-boarding processes and complete employee action workflows, regular and ad hoc reporting, audits, and other data validation or reporting exercises.
* Notify the appropriate departments of employee hires and separations.
* Assist with responding to questions about payroll, benefits, time and attendance, hiring processes, and company policies, with the support of HR staff and the Director of HR & Talent Acquisition.
* Assist with talent acquisition functions including interview scheduling, resume review, and candidate screening.
* Provide broad support to the team, including scheduling meetings and coordinating logistics, maintaining shared drives, keeping organization charts current, and other special projects.
* Maintain a high degree of confidentiality and discretion regarding business matters, data, and documents.

 **What you'll bring:**

* Ability to interact effectively with diverse people in different contexts and foster equity and inclusion through self-awareness, cultural sensitivity, and valuing others
* Dedication to public service with an unfailing commitment to act with civility, be nonpartisan in performing CSG Justice Center duties, and be a responsible steward of member and donor funds
* At least 2 years of relevant experience providing HR administrative support or equivalent educational experience
* Expertise with Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
* Experience navigating Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) and Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS)
* Experience with project management, scheduling, or other organizational software a plus
* Strong interpersonal skills and confidence to communicate with colleagues at all levels
* Customer-service orientation ability to answer employee questions quickly and accurately
* Extreme flexibility, organizational skills, and ability to easily shift priorities
* Excellent follow-through, time management, and attention to detail
* Experience with mid-sized workplaces (100-500 employees) as well as nonprofit or other social impact organizations preferred
* The highest degree of trustworthiness, reliability, integrity, confidentiality, diplomacy, and tact
* Reliable and secure internet/data connection and flexibility for using a personal device for internet connectivity during business travel. A cost offset is provided by CSG.

 **How you apply:**


If you're interested in helping us drive change across the country, you should upload the following elements with your application:

* Cover letter
* Resume
* At least three professional references

*We will consider all paid and unpaid experience relative to this position, including internships, fellowships,* *and volunteer activities.*

 *CSG believes that pay equity and pay transparency advance workplace fairness. Compensation will be equitable and based on experience and geography. The salary range for this position is* ***$57,500-$78,000*** *per year. Salary ranges are subject to change based on work location and market conditions. Salary ranges are subject to change based on work location and market conditions.*

*Our organization offers flexibility in work arrangements, allowing for remote work or a hybrid model. Candidates residing in the NYC metropolitan area will be considered for hybrid model employment.*

 *To learn more about careers at the CSG Justice Center, and about our comprehensive benefit offerings, including medical, dental, vision, retirement, paid time off, PSLF eligibility and more, please visit our website* *here**.*

  

We welcome and value diversity in our staff, including race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, educational attainment, disability, protected veteran status, and personal experience with the criminal justice system.

  

CSG is an Affirmative Action/Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. CSG participates in E-Verify.

title: Fundraiser/Canvasser for Non-Profits
description:
One Sixty Fundraising are looking for **outgoing, confident** and **passionate activists** to join our sociable, high energy fundraising team in Jersey City & NYC!

**Hours: Full Time - Tuesday to Saturday 10am-6pm**  
**Pay: $20ph (base pay) plus uncapped bonuses - OTE $35**

One Sixty International work with incredible non-profits such as **the ASPCA,** **The Nature Conservancy, Children International and Amnesty International** to generate vital funds so they can keep doing the amazing work that they do!

We're looking for energetic, confident communicators who aren't afraid to strike up a conversation to represent one of our incredible charity partners as a fundraiser/canvasser!

**The Position:** You will work with your team on different busy streets in the city where you will engage in incredible conversations with members of the public, inspiring them to become a supporter of the non-profit you are representing through an ongoing donation. Each and every conversation you have will have a positive impact, making the world a better place!

If you're interested in fighting poverty, campaigning for equality for all, promoting animal welfare or saving the planet - we want to hear from you!

**No experience required!** Full, paid training will be provided. Instead we're looking for:

* Highly confident, sociable individuals who want to be a part of a high-energy, lively team!
* Passionate activists who genuinely care about having an impact and making the world a better place
* Charismatic communicators, who thrive on having meaningful, engaging conversations
* People with an unshakeable belief that every conversation can have an impact

People with experience in the following sectors/positions are especially suited to fundraising: performing arts/theatre, canvassing, sales, customer service, retail, bar work, serving and hospitality. It's also a fantastic opportunity for recent graduates looking for an entry-level non-profit position to kick start their career!

**We Offer:**

* Full time hours - **Monday to Friday 10am-6pm**
* Base pay of **$20 per hour plus uncapped daily and weekly bonuses (OTE $35ph)** paid weekly
* **Paid time off**
* **Paid training** and ongoing opportunities for development
* **Progression plan** - ability to move up into Team Lead and Management positions, with our career development plans.
* **Benefits** including **medical, dental and vision** insurance, **401k**, as well as an **employee assistance program -** which gives you access to a range of services, for both you and your family!
* Regular **paid socials** with your team
* Opportunities for **travel to our other US offices (including Miami, California, Seattle and Austin) and our UK offices**!

**Requirements:**

* **Ability to work 5 full days per week - Monday to Friday 10am-6pm**
* **Available to work full time for a minimum of 3 months**
* Must be aged 18 years or over
* Happy to work outside!
* Must be willing to travel to various locations in NY and canvass outdoors and/or at large events.
* Some experience or interest in social justice, activism, poverty alleviation, humanitarian causes, the environment, charitable causes, and/or non profit organizations.

**One Sixty Fundraising are the leading fundraising agency in the USA and UK.** We partner with incredible causes to connect them with donors, enabling them to continue to do the amazing work they do. We're a value led organization who recognize how important our people are.

**Interested in becoming a part of One Sixty Fundraising? Apply for the street fundraiser/canvasser role today! Zoom interviews taking place this week for an immediate start.**

title: Shipping & Receiving Clerk
description:
**Job Summary**


The **Shipping & Receiving Clerk** is responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate receipt, packaging, and shipment of products to meet customer requirements. This position requires strong computer skills, basic math proficiency, and the ability to operate warehouse equipment such as forklifts. The successful candidate must possess a valid driver's license and demonstrate attention to detail in all tasks.

**Essential Functions:**

* Accurately receive parts from suppliers, verifying both the quantity and quality of items received.
* Efficiently package and ship products in accordance with company policies and customer requirements, utilizing best practices to ensure safe and secure delivery.
* Generate and process necessary paperwork for parts to be submitted to inspection or other departments as required. Maintain accurate shipment records in the database.
* Assist with the logistics and shipping for East/West trade shows.
* May be required to drive company van to pick up parts or deliver to service suppliers, if required.
* Uphold company standards by promoting good housekeeping practices and adhering to safety objectives through consistent implementation of established policies and procedures.
* Promptly inform management of any in-transit damage to products or shipments.
* Perform additional clerical duties as needed to support the logistics department.

**Qualifications/Minimum requirements:**

* U.S. Citizenship required.
* Ability to read, write, and speak in English proficiently.
* High School Diploma, GED, or relevant vocational training preferred.
* Strong communication and organizational abilities.
* 2+ years of experience in a shipping and receiving role in a manufacturing warehouse preferred.
* Proficiency with basic math, including the use of scales and calculators.
* Competent with Microsoft Office Suite preferred
* Experience in data entry and report generation using database or inventory management software, such as Visual ERP, preferred.
* Experience with shipping portals preferred.
* Experience shipping dangerous goods preferred.
* Knowledge of warehouse procedures, standards, and practices preferred.
* Must be able to operate warehouse machinery such as forklifts, pallet jacks, and hand trucks.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to traverse the warehouse and access various storage spaces, including shelving units, by stretching, squatting, and reaching.
* Capable of lifting up to 50 lbs.
* Must be able to stand and walk for the majority of the shift, with frequent pushing and pulling activities.

**Job Title:** Shipping & Receiving Clerk


**Job Type:** Full time

**FLSA Classification:** Non-exempt (hourly)

**Salary Range:** $18 to $23 per hour. This estimated range represents a good faith projection of what we believe is a competitive compensation range for this position. Please understand that the offered salary will be determined based on factors such as the applicant's credentials, experiences, and the specific requirements of the role, as well as potential internal equity and external market considerations. We do not customarily hire at the top end of the range. East/West adheres to pay transparency and equity principles and strives to remain competitive within the market. We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds and experiences to apply. The full compensation package will be shared and discussed during the hiring process. In addition to the base salary, East/West is committed to supporting our team's well-being and professional growth through a comprehensive benefits package. This generous benefits package, includes but is not limited to:

* Medical, Dental, Vision
* Life Insurance, Long-Term Disability
* Aflac Voluntary benefits (Critical Illness, Accident, Hospital, STD)
* PTO (3 weeks accrued first year!)
