title: Scheduling Assistant
description:
**Position: Scheduling Assistant**

**Reports to: Senior Manager of Programming Scheduling**

**Scheduling Assistant (TEMP 3 months)**

**Salary: $25/hr**

**Job Description**

The Scheduling Assistant assists with the daily log scheduling of program and promo elements for HITN TV, ensuring daily logs are managed strategically, completed correctly, and delivered on time. In this role, the Scheduling Assistant is responsible for correctly scheduling all on-air elements and working closely with programming and network operations to fill all inventory and time out the log correctly.

**Strategy:**

* Understand long and short-term programming goals to execute scheduling strategies properly

**Scheduling:**

* Responsible for generating daily programming logs.
* Input promo metadata accurately in the scheduling system.
* Create promo rotators (flights) for elements to schedule correctly.
* Write and input all primary (promos, interstitials) and secondary elements on assigned logs.
* Run performance reports and adjust when necessary.
* Re-arrange elements to keep breaks consistent.
* Maintain formats in the traffic system.
* QC Logs for accuracy and adherence to strategies.
* Make last-minute changes when needed after logs have been finalized.

**Requirements:**

· Four-year college degree preferred. Must have at least two years of hands-on experience in scheduling, operations and administrative arenas that provide a working understanding of the scheduling process. Knowledge of post-production is a plus.

· Must be highly detail-oriented, be able to perform under tight deadlines, and thrive on working in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment.

· Strong communication skills are required to communicate effectively with various departments daily. The ability to work closely with others is a must.

· Excellent organizational, time management, and prioritization skills are required. Must multitask, effectively coordinate changing priorities, and handle tight deadlines.

· Mathematical and reasoning skills are essential. Must have expertise in analyzing program and research data and accurately positioning promotional elements to maximize effectiveness. The ability to make decisions and recommendations on the placement of promos based on audience composition and priorities is preferred.

· Understanding of network computer systems used to access research, programming, and scheduling information is preferred. Must learn and have a working understanding of scheduling systems. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Outlook is required.

Job Type: Temporary

Pay: $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Experience:

* Customer service: 2 years (Preferred)
* Administration: 1 year (Preferred)
* Computer skills: 1 year (Preferred)
* Scheduling: 2 years (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Required)

Location:

* Brooklyn, NY 11205 (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11205 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY 11205: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Assistant General Manager
description:
Our full-service restaurant Little Beet Table is renowned for offering an exceptional dining experience,

blending innovative cuisine with unparalleled service. Located in the heart of New York City, we pride

ourselves on our vibrant atmosphere and commitment to excellence. We are looking for an experienced

and dynamic Assistant General Manager to join our team and help us continue to deliver outstanding

service to our guests.

**Role Description**

* Support GM in overseeing all aspects of the operation within the restaurant. Oversee all operations in the absence of the GM and able to assume key responsibilities
* Maintain a strong presence on the floor, interacting with guests to ensure an exceptional dining experience
* Assist in overseeing all aspects of restaurant operations, including front-of-house and back-of-house activities
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the restaurant
* Recruit, train, and supervise restaurant staff, ensuring high performance and morale
* Ensure all food and beverage products meet the restaurant’s standards and cost for quality and presentation
* Manage P&L, forecasting, COGs, and inventory control
* Ensures Occupational Safety & Health Act, local health and safety codes, and company safety and security policies are met. Must maintain an “A” health inspection rating at all times.

**Qualifications**

* Minimum 1 year of restaurant management experience in a restaurant with comparable steps of service and volume
* Toast POS, Clover, or similar POS experience
* Previous experience with P&L, forecasting, inventory, and COGs is strongly preferred
* Strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities required
* Proficiency in Spanish, French, and/or Arabic a plus
* Certifications: A NYC Food Handler's License is required to be considered for this position.

**Benefits**

* Enrollment in Company-contributed health coverage plan, including dental and vision
* 10 days PTO
* 401k with up to 4% match after ninety (90) days of employment
* Life insurance coverage is fully paid by the Company
* Pre-tax commuter benefits
* Pet insurance
* Team member discounts at all our brands

*Convive Brands is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected class. Convive Brands celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Crane Operator
description:
Derecktor Shipyard in Mamaroneck, NY, is seeking a qualified and experienced Crane Operator. The Crane Operator is responsible to maintain and operate overhead crane and forklift to lift, move and position loads in a safe manner. Operator responsibilities will include the haul and launch of commercial vessels and yachts, and the maintenance and repair of crane and shipyard equipment. Shift hours are from 6:30am to 3:00pm, M-F.

**Responsibilities/Duties**

· Ability to safely operate a Derrick Crane, hoists, forklift and all mobile cranes at the shipyard.

· Transfer loads and boats from/to upland cradle positions to/from the water safely

· Bind loads to cranes

· Inspect equipment and machinery

· Keep and update maintenance and activity log

· Carry out basic repairs to machines

· Set up machinery based on onboard load computers

· Coordinate with ground operators and interpret hand and verbal signals

· Follow safety guidelines and protocols

· Be able to train unskilled personnel

· Be able to conduct a jobsite risk assessment and communicate tasks to stakeholders

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

· Attention to detail

· Crane Rigging

· Knowledge of hand signals/ radio signals

· Safety Consciousness

**Qualifications**

· At least 3-5 years experience in Derrick Crane operation with minimum 100 tons.

· Valid rigging and crane operator certification from OSHA approved or state facility.

· Proven experience working with an overhead crane, in all types of weather conditions.

· Licensed as required under federal, state and local law.

· Mechanical experience necessary to perform maintenance and repairs on crane and shipyard equipment.

· Crane Operator Certificate from a nationally recognized and accredited certification program preferred.

· Experience in the marine industry a plus.

**Work Environment Summary:**

Applicant may be subject to environmental conditions such as cold, heat, exposure to noise, hazards, and confined spaces/close quarters. Applicant must be able to access all areas of the shipyard and company property including docks. Shipyard work is often noisy and dirty.

**Physical Demands:**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, lift heavy loads (up to 50lbs.), climb ladders and steps, use hands and fingers, and see, talk and hear others.

**Benefits:**

Benefits include paid holidays, paid time off, health benefits, 401K with company match and company sponsored Short- and Long-Term Disability insurance and Life insurance.

**EEO Statement:**

Derecktor is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be provided equal consideration without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, genetic information, military status, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or protected veteran status in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

**Shift hours are 6:30am - 3:00pm**

Pay: From $31.00 per hour

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance

title: Pediatric Sales Representative
description:
**Description**


**You have what it takes: a competitive drive coupled with exceptional sales ability.**


In this role, you will be an integral part of a sales team developing and managing an assigned territory. You will have the opportunity to implement clients’ marketing plan by using your professional expertise, clinical training, and judgement. You will:

* Utilize marketing and selling materials designed for a respective audience
* Plan and organize activities to ensure consistent coverage of the territory depending on each client’s needs
* Engage in meaningful dialogue that addresses the needs of the health provider and patient
* Provide educational and scientific support for decisions to physicians, practitioners, and nursing staff

**Essential Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree
* 1-2 years' business to business (B2B) or 1-2 years' pharmaceutical sales experience
* Ability to travel and possess a valid driver’s license to drive to assigned healthcare accounts
* Must live within territory or within territory boundaries.

**Desired Requirements:**

* Track record of success with outside sales experience

  

The annual base salary for this position ranges from $70,000 to $72,000. The base salary range represents the anticipated low and high of the Syneos Health range for this position. Actual salary will vary based on various factors such as the candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. In addition, some positions may include a company car or car allowance and eligibility to earn commissions/bonus based on company and / or individual performance.
At Syneos Health, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If your past experience doesn’t align perfectly, we encourage you to apply anyway. At times, we will consider transferable skills from previous roles. We also encourage you to join our Talent Network to stay connected to additional career opportunities.

**Why Syneos Health?** Here, the work is challenging, and the pace is exhilarating. By joining one of our commercial teams, you’re empowered to succeed with the support, resources, and autonomy that you need. The diversification and breadth of our new and existing partnerships create a multitude of career paths and employment opportunities. Syneos Health has launched more sales teams in the last 5 years across all major therapeutic areas than the top 25 pharma companies combined. Join our game-changing, global company dedicated to creating better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Experience the thrill of knowing that your everyday efforts are contributing to improving patients’ lives around the world.


Work Here Matters Everywhere | How are you inspired to change lives?

*Syneos Health companies are affirmative action/equal opportunity employers (Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled)*


Syneos Health has a voluntary COVID-19 vaccination policy. We strongly encourage all employees to be fully vaccinated. Additionally, certain local governments or Syneos Health customers may have vaccine requirements that apply to some of our employees. These employees are required to submit proof of vaccination to Syneos Health and maintain compliance with these requirements.  

 At Syneos Health, we believe in providing an environment and culture in which Our People can thrive, develop and advance. We reward and recognize our people by providing valuable benefits and a quality-of-life balance. The benefits for this position will include a competitive compensation package, Health benefits to include Medical, Dental and Vision, Company match 401k, flexible paid time off (PTO) and sick time. Because certain states and municipalities have regulated paid sick time requirements, eligibility for paid sick time may vary depending on where you work. Syneos Health complies with all applicable federal, state, and municipal paid sick time requirements.

title: Engineering Program Manager, Environmental
company: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
description:
**Description**
---------------

  

  

  

About the Role

  

The Port Authority of NY & NJ Engineering is a diverse and award-winning national leader in innovative planning, design, and construction of the most critical links of regional and national transportation infrastructure spanning New York and New Jersey. The Port Authority is seeking an Engineering Program Manager, Environmental. Reporting directly to the Chief Civil and Environmental Engineer, the successful candidate will lead environmental design staff to deliver projects, ensure environmental compliance, and play a critical role to keep the region moving

  

Responsibilities

  

* Lead staff and consultants to accurately interpret and apply environmental regulations and compliance requirements to projects.
* Create and maintain partnership with federal, state and local agencies with environmental jurisdiction including the USEPA, NJDEP, NYDEC, NYCDEP and Army Corps of Engineers to interpret the various environmental laws, codes and requirements of those agencies and provide expert advice and guidance.
* Lead the design development of environmental design and permit preparation and ensure that a comprehensive permit register is used to track and manage permit list for each project.
* Perform QA/QC of construction documents, permits and applications for both in- house and consultant work for compliance with Authority guidelines and external requirements.
* Strategically and proactively address environmental matters by providing subject matter expert advice on the best course of action aligned with agency priorities.
* Represent Environmental Engineering at meetings with internal and external stakeholders.
* Ensure that the environmental portion of projects and efforts are on time and on budget. Work with the Chief Civil & Environmental Engineer to resolve scope, budget or schedule issues.
* Oversee and manage several Senior Principal Engineers and Principal Engineers
* Provide technical assistance to Law, Real Estate, Line Departments and other Authority departments as necessary.
* Represent the Chief Civil & Environmental Engineer, as required, on complex environmental technical matters
  

Minimum Qualifications

  

* A Bachelor of Science degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering from an accredited university or college
* Experience managing and designing environmental projects related to remediating soil and groundwater contamination, environmental site investigations, asbestos and lead abatement, environmental compliance at transportation facilities in New York and New Jersey.
* In-depth understanding of the related Federal, State and Local regulations and regulatory processes, and be familiar with the State (NJ & NY) and local municipality regulatory agencies personnel and processes.
* A minimum of 12 years of progressively responsible experience in the aforementioned areas is required with a minimum of 5 years managing environmental engineers/scientists engaged in the aforementioned areas.
* Excellent verbal, communication and organizational skills
* A Professional Engineer’s license for New York or New Jersey is required
* Must possess a valid driver’s license

  



  

Desired Qualifications

  

* A professional Engineer’s license for both New York and New Jersey.bas
* Experience working at Aviation, Rail and Marine facilities
  

Selection Process

  

The application process varies by position, but typically includes an initial phone interview for qualified candidates, followed by a more in-depth interview(s) and/or assessment(s). Selected candidates who are made a conditional job offer will be asked to undergo a background check.

  

Compensation & Benefits

  

The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey offers a competitive benefits package, hybrid work options for many positions, and a professional environment that supports development and recognizes achievement.

  

Click here for more information about benefits, our culture, and career development opportunities.

title: OR Assistant | Per Diem
description:
**Description**  



  

Holy Name is New Jersey's last remaining independent, Catholic health system, comprising a comprehensive 361-bed acute care medical center, a cancer center, medical fitness center, residential hospice, nursing school, and physician network. The system has a national reputation for providing culturally sensitive care to a diverse population, drawing patients from across the New York City region to its specialty centers and renowned doctors. Holy Name's mission to provide technologically advanced, compassionate and personalized care extends across a continuum that encompasses education, prevention, diagnosis, treatment, rehabilitation and wellness maintenance. The system is known as a high-quality, low-cost provider of extraordinary clinical care given by compassionate, highly trained physicians and staff.  

  

**A Brief Overview**  

Functions as a member of the surgical team under the direct supervision of a RN. Responsible for transporting patients from their rooms to surgery, from one area to another within the department of surgical services and the hospital. Responsible for additional functions including assisting in general cleaning, running errands, relaying messages, assisting with patient care and room turnover.  

  

**What you will do**

* Correctly identifies patients and safely transports them to and from the operating room, holding area, or post anesthesia care area
* Helps turnover OR suites
* Assists in positioning, lifting and transferring patients as directed
* Assists with case set up for assigned rooms
* Cleans designated supply areas and adheres to Infection Control and departmental guidelines in doing so
* Cleans designated equipment in area assigned and adheres to guidelines
* Assists with general upkeep of area to provide safe, clean, organized environment
* Performs between case clean-up of anesthesia equipment and maintains changing circuits and tubing
* Communicates with Sterile Processing to obtain supplies as needed.
* Obtains necessary equipment, supplies and positioning aides for cases
* Restocks sterile supplies in OR storage areas and OR rooms as needed
* Returns clean equipment to appropriate storage area
* Checks and stocks solutions, rotating inventory as needed
* Orders and maintains adequate par levels for all anesthesia supplies and equipment
* Completes assignments in a timely manner and utilizes time effectively
* Reports equipment problems to the appropriate person
* Demonstrates proficiency in Autoclave use
* Stocks anesthesia carts as directed
* Stocks anesthesia closet/supply area as directed
* Performs BI test/A test
* Transport specimens, equipment or supplies utilizing appropriate and safe techniques
* Retrieves blood from the Blood Bank
* Performs and documents temperature, humidity checks for OR room.
* Performs and documents temperature checks for refrigerator/freezer
* Provides considerate respectful care focused upon the patients’ individual needs
* Affirms the patient’s right to make decisions regarding his/her medical care, including the decision to discontinue treatment, to the extent permitted by law
* Demonstrates an understanding of the range of care needed based on the age of the patients cared for. Demonstrates knowledge of growth, development and/or adult health throughout the life span as appropriate to the job performed
* Requires heavy lifting of equipment and trays
* Physical stamina and the ability to stand for long periods during surgeries

 **Education Qualifications**

* High School Diploma Or equivalent experience Preferred

 **Experience Qualifications**

* 1-3 years One year clinical experience in an accredited hospital with OR experience. Preferred

 **Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

* Knowledge of Operating Room
* Ability to understand the operation of some equipment and machinery
* Ability to function independently
* Strong professional, organizational, and interpersonal skills to effectively relate with all members of the healthcare team.

 **Licenses and Certifications**

* BCLS - Basic Life Support Required

  

Holy Name is a mission-driven facility whose quality standards and philosophy are rooted in the principles of its founders, the Sisters of St. Joseph of Peace. Those principles are exercised daily by the Medical Center's dedicated and talented team of physicians, nurses, allied health employees, and a wide variety of non-clinical administrative and operational staff members. Holy Name is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: PC-Case Management Supervisor
description:
**Description**  



  

**Summary:** The Refugee Resettlement Department at Catholic Charities Community Services provides assistance to newly arrived families from diverse backgrounds who are resettling in New York City and the Lower Hudson Valley through case management, employment-based, and educational services. The Preferred Communities (PC) Case Management Supervisor will support the PC Programs Manager and facilitate the provision of comprehensive social services in multiple PC programs. The PC Case Management Supervisor will supervise case managers and review cases for best practices and contract compliance.  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities** include the following. Other duties may be assigned.* Oversee client eligibility for enrollment assessments and provide guidance for staff.
* Review, edit, and provide feedback on reports and assessments, ensuring they are completed in a timely manner and in accordance with program guidelines.
* Coordinate closely with PC staff to ensure feedback has been integrated into reports and provide ongoing training and support to ensure reports are completed consistently and correctly.
* Review case notes for quality, completeness, timeliness, and accuracy, and provide individual and group case note feedback on an ongoing basis.
* Submit reports on time and liaise with USCCB on delayed reports and extension requests, if needed.
* Complete case file reviews, in collaboration with the PC-Programs Manager and the Quality Assurance and Monitoring Manager, to ensure that staff maintain copies of documents and reports in each file in compliance with ORR and USCCB guidelines.
* Provide intensive case supervision for the team, including consultation for complicated cases, crisis response and intervention, and additional programmatic support as needed.
* Support PC-Programs Manager to develop internal program policy and procedures guidance, such as guides for working in the field, creating case files, and utilizing tools to meet program requirements.
* Work as part of a team to provide comprehensive trauma-informed, strength-based services to clients through coordination of cases and effective communication between team members and departments.
* Develop resources for the PC team, including building relationships with social service providers and community-based organizations to increase referral network for clients.
* Responsible for performance management of supervisees. Assist the PC-Programs Manager and RR department leadership to interview and recruit staff and program volunteers/interns. Make recommendations for hiring and performance reviews.
* On occasion, carry a small caseload as needed to support resettlement staff and for training purposes.
* Maintain ongoing communication with supervisor and participate in weekly supervision.
* Participate in program meetings, staff development activities, case conferences and other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**
==================

  

**Education and/or experience required:*** MSW degree or an equivalent advanced degree in a relevant field **or**, bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, plus approximately 2 years of relevant experience.
* Knowledgeable about local social services and experience working with immigrant populations.
* Fluent in English and a language common to refugee communities.

**Skills, Licenses, and/or competencies required:**
===================================================

* Excellent organizational skills, communication (oral & written), and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to manage deadlines and high-volume communication in a fast-paced environment.
* Highly motivated self-starter with strong problem-solving skills combined with the proven ability to multi-task, prioritize duties, be responsive, and manage time effectively.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, SharePoint, etc.). Ability to navigate multiple online database systems.
* Ability to work and communicate effectively and sensitively in a multicultural environment, and serve as an advocate for refugee populations.

**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work:**
=============================================


This is a full-time position. Days of work are Monday – Friday, evening or weekend hours may be required depending on report deadlines.

  

Working conditions and physical demands required:


 The demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

* Ability to travel regularly throughout the service delivery area at least 60% of the time using reliable transportation, traversing streets, ascending/descending stairs, and exposed to outside weather conditions.
* Remain in a stationary position at a workstation and use a computer approximately 40% of the time.

title: Full Time Sales Associate
description:
AG Jeans is seeking a Full Time Sales Associate for its retail location in the Woodbury Commons Premium Outlets

The Sales Associate is responsible for supporting sales performance, operations, visual merchandising along with ensuring that a superior customer experience is delivered.

The Sales Associate consistently focuses on being effective and efficient while supporting the brand.

This position will report to the Store Manager.

**Responsibilities:**

Sales & Profitability:

* Continually drive sales performance at store, by meeting or exceeding topline sales goals • Place an emphasis on driving and understanding all store metrics and KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)
* Seek efficiency with controllable operational expenses (shipping, supplies, etc.)

Operations:

* Ensure all company policies and procedures are adhered to including loss prevention measures
* Responsible for all in store company assets including merchandise inventory, monetary assets, information and furniture/equipment
* Support assignments related to inventory including but not limited to transfers, markdowns, style reconciliation and receiving stock
* Support the operations team as necessary

Visuals:

* Support the execution of all visual directives as set out by HQ, including floor sets, store windows and in-store collateral (signage, digital content) as directed by store manager
* Maintain impeccable visual standards for all product in store, both on the sales floor and back of house

Customer Service:

* Ensure that a superior customer experience is delivered to every guest that encounters our brand, store and store team
* Support and grow the clienteling program to meet or exceed company objectives Additional

Responsibilities:

* Partner with peer stores and next level management to achieve company objectives
* Responsibilities may change as deemed necessary in order to support brand initiatives

Requirements:

* A genuine interest in the fashion industry
* Knowledge of retail POS systems
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel)
* Sound understating of retail math and retail specific key performance indicators
* Excellent communication skills
* Minimum 1 year sales experience, preferably in luxury or contemporary apparel & accessories
* Some lifting required (up to approximately 25lbs)
* Ability to climb ladders
* Ability to work daytime, evenings and weekends

Benefits:

* Hourly + Commission
* Generous Clothing Allowance

Job description is intended to provide a general overview of the position. It is not an exhaustive list of responsibilities, skills, or qualifications associated with the role.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift
* Night shift

Experience:

* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Pre-op/PACU RN
description:
CitiMed Surgery Center is seeking to fill a full time and per diem Pre/Post Op Nurse position. The Pre/Post Op Nurse must be a professional nurse who has clinical and administrative responsibility for the pre/post-operative area. The Pre/Post Op Nurse is responsible and accountable for the assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of pre/post anesthesia nursing care of an assigned group of patients at an Ambulatory Surgery Center.

Qualifications: **\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*Spanish speaking preferred.\\*\\*\\*\\***

***\\*\\*\\*\\*New Graduates are welcome\\*\\*\\****

* Licensed in NY as a registered professional nurse (RN) or licensed practice nurse (LPN).
* Post Anesthesia nursing with critical care experience required.
* BLS and ACLS required.
* Certification for pre or post anesthesia nursing preferred.
* Current IV certification from an approved facility preferred.
* Language skills: Ability to read, write and communicate effectively both written and orally.
* Computer and keyboard proficiency.

Working Conditions:

* Works inside.
* Must be able to work under stress and able to set priorities effectively.
* The potential for exposure to blood and body fluids does exist.
* May have exposure to patients with communicable diseases.
* May have exposure to hazardous equipment and I or agents.
* Physical demands require employee to stand for extended periods of time, lifting, moving heavy equipment and patients, manual dexterity and other physical activities for patient care.

Responsibilities:

* Directs patient care and indirect patient care, medical record preparations and reviews for completeness
* Is responsible and accountable for post anesthesia ambulatory nursing process
* Follows guidelines of ASPAN and ANA consisting of the six steps of assessment, nursing diagnosis, outcome identification, planning and evaluation of perioperative care with recognition of age related needs for adult, geriatric and pediatric patients
* Establishes, implements, and monitors, in conjunction with other members of the patient care team, standards of patient care within framework of the standards of this Center. Assesses and responds to individual, psychosocial, and spiritual needs of the patient
* Directs Licensed Practical Nurses and unlicensed assistive personnel I perioperative team towards safe, competent, compassionate, individualized and goal-directed patient care
* Conducts narcotic counts in the specified manner with another registered nurse, if necessary
* Maintains inventory of narcotics and controlled drugs requisitioned by the anesthesiologist for the operating room. Oversees drug inventory responsibilities for the Center
* Implements and insures that physician orders are performed including orders delegated to other health care professionals
* Demonstrates understanding and interpretation of diagnostic measures such as lab tests, radiology exams and EKG
* Ensures that the Code carts are fully equipped, defibrillators are in operational readiness and that daily checks are completed
* Conducts patient postoperative follow up calls and completes all documentations within the defined timeframe
* Changes gas cylinders as necessary to maintain medical gas system integrity. Ensures communication of need for replacement tanks or system problems. Monitors gas outlets for shutoff at end of each day

Job Types: Full-time, Per diem

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Anesthesiology
* Orthopedics
* Pain Medicine
* Surgery

Physical Setting:

* Ambulatory surgery center

Experience:

* Nursing: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* BLS Certification (Preferred)
* RN (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Golf General laborer (Mount Tabor)
description:
**Description**


At BrightView, the best teams are created and maintained here. If you are searching for your next fulfilling career, picture yourself on a best-in-class team where you can grow to be your brightest. We’re looking for a Golf Course Groundsperson. Can you picture yourself here?

**You’d be responsible for:**

* Mowing small turf areas using “fly-mo” or small push power mowers
* Mowing using large mowers
* Trimming and edging using a gas powered edger/trimmer
* Operating a gas powered blower
* Trimming shrubs and low trees to shape and improve growth or to remove damaged leaves, branches, or twigs using shears, pruners, or gas powered hedge trimmers
* Picking up leaves, trash, and cut grass and placing onto a truck or trailer
* Performing weeding by hand or using a garden hoe or hula hoe
* The ability to report for daily work at different job sites within region to perform required tasks
* Greenskeeper and/or Irrigator duties as assigned.
* Regular Heavy lifting up to 50 pounds
* Regular exposure to outside environment including rain, cold, sun, or night
* Repetitive movement- standing, walking, twisting, turning, bending, squatting, stooping

**And while not mandatory, it would be great if you also have:**

* Bilingual (English/Spanish)

**Here’s what to know about working here:**


Here at BrightView, we’re as passionate about caring for our clients as we are about caring for each other. Though we’re the nation’s leading landscape company, we maintain a small company feel and supportive environment that makes our team members feel at home.


If you’re looking to join a team of talented go-getters who tackle big vision projects other companies could only dream of, you just might have found your match. With our range of services, including landscape design, development, maintenance and enhancements, there’s no limit to what we can do, and what you can achieve.

**Growing Everyday**


Like the communities we serve, you are on a constant path of discovery to shape your career and personal development. In addition to best-in-class opportunities and competitive salary, you may be eligible for benefits and perks like:

* Paid time off
* Health and wellness coverage
* 401k savings plan

**Start Your Bright New Career Journey**

 *BrightView is an Equal Employment Opportunity and E-Verify Employer.*

title: Clinical Manager Social Work Inpatient Svs
description:
**Description**


Penn Medicine is dedicated to our tripartite mission of providing the highest level of care to patients, conducting innovative research, and educating future leaders in the field of medicine. Working for this leading academic medical center means collaboration with top clinical, technical and business professionals across all disciplines.  

  

Today at Penn Medicine, someone will make a breakthrough. Someone will heal a heart, deliver hopeful news, and give comfort and reassurance. Our employees shape our future each day. Are you living your life's work?  

Summary:

  

* Under supervision from the Director of Social Work/Case Management and other clinical directors, assists in providing comprehensive oversight of the program/department on assigned units including senior level clinical leadership in treatment planning and patient care, program development and refinement, performance improvement activities and supervision and evaluation of staff performance. Provides primary oversight of the Social Work department when the Director is not on site, along with assigned administrative duties, including departmental staff meetings, payroll, staff attendance and other inpatient and/or hospital wide meetings.


Responsibilities:

  

* Provide supervisory clinical expertise in treatment planning and patient care to direct reports in assigned units.
* Oversee and assist staff in managing clinical crises.
* Provide clinical supervision to staff and facilitate team meetings.
* Assist the Director in providing orientation for new employees and clearly communicating expectations.
* Set goals for staff training, education and self-development in collaboration with clinical and administrative directors and oversee attendance at trainings.
* Ensure staff compliance with annual competencies and assist in maintenance of human resource files with director.
* Collaborate with Social Work/Case Management Director to develop and oversee all aspects of clinical services using best practices approaches for respective clinical inpatient population.
* Ensures that best practice approaches are implemented in their clinical area.
* Recommend areas for overall staff training and development as well as program growth in collaboration with administrative, and medical directors.
* Monitor hospital resources and develop staff assigned to group schedules, and patient caseloads according to need. Work with other managers and coordinators to strengthen cross coverage across units.
* Sets a tone and facilitates good working team relationships and communication; models Caring Customer Service behaviors for internal and external customers.
* Set clear expectations for teamwork among staff.
* Act as liaison within the PHBH continuum.
* Works with director and nurse manager team to ensure collaboration across wings for patient care, discharges, transfers, transportation, and shared staff meetings.
* Provide regular feedback of performance and annually evaluate the performance of assigned clinical staff.
* Monitor staff progress toward the attainment of annual goals.
* Participate in the preparation and revision of policies and procedures pertaining to Princeton House’s overall inpatient social work case management services.
* Provide support and assistance with key information for Utilization Reviewer and UM process.
* Monitor daily census of hospital programs on assigned units. Collaborates with clinical and administrative directors, marketing, and program staff to attain budgeted census and length of stay targets.
* Work with social work director to ensure that the department services and staff remains in compliance with various regulatory bodies such as Joint Commission, Medicare, Medicaid, and the New Jersey DHS, DMHAS and DCF and annual required trainings and licenses.
* Perform chart audits to assess staff compliance with documentation requirements.
* Assists the Social Work Director in the implementation of hospital and program performance improvement plans, initiatives and goals.
* Support customer service and performance improvement goals of the department; collaborate with other caregivers/staff within and outside of the department to develop means of enhancing patient care and service.
* Provide unit-level oversight of issues such as incidents, complaints, length of stay, status at discharge, and attendance to ensure best possible treatment outcomes, in collaboration with the department Director.
* With the Social Work Director, partner with PHBH marketing to market program(s) through a variety of mechanisms including presentations, meetings with referral sources, development of marketing strategies, etc.
* Promote and maintain standards of confidentiality.
* Participate in the coordination and supervision of weekend coverage.


Credentials:

  

* Licensed Clinical SW (Required)
* Independent licensure (LCSW, LCADC)
* Licensed Clinical Alcohol & Drug Counselor (Required)
* Independent licensure (LCSW, LCADC)


Education or Equivalent Experience:

  

* Master of Arts or Science (Required)
* Master's degree in Social work or related field and 5+ years mental health field and treatment of the program's patient population and 2+ years management experience.


We believe that the best care for our patients starts with the best care for our employees. Our employee benefits programs help our employees get healthy and stay healthy. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits program that includes one of the finest prepaid tuition assistance programs in the region. Penn Medicine employees are actively engaged and committed to our mission. Together we will continue to make medical advances that help people live longer, healthier lives.  

  

Live Your Life's Work
We are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, marital status, familial status, genetic information, domestic or sexual violence victim status, citizenship status, military status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.
company_description: We're proud of our physicians at Penn Medicine. Our clinical teams value lifelong learning, and Penn offers excellent and competitive professional development for physicians throughout their careers.

title: Strategy Insights & Planning Associate
description:
* Princeton, New Jersey
* United States
* Insights & Analytics
* Strategy Insights & Planning
* 21208
 **ZS** is a place where passion changes lives. As a management consulting and technology firm focused on transforming global healthcare and beyond, our most valuable asset is our people. Here you’ll work side-by-side with a powerful collective of thinkers and experts shaping solutions from start to finish. At ZS, we believe that making an impact demands a different approach; and that’s why here your ideas elevate actions, and here you’ll have the freedom to define your own path and pursue cutting-edge work. We partner collaboratively with our clients to develop products that create value and deliver company results across critical areas of their business including portfolio strategy, customer insights, research and development, operational and technology transformation, marketing strategy and many more. If you dare to think differently, join us, and find a path where your passion can change lives. **Our most** **valuable asset** **is our people**.
At **ZS** we honor the visible and invisible elements of our identities, personal experiences and belief systems—the ones that comprise us as individuals, shape who we are and
make us unique. We believe your personal interests, identities, and desire to learn are part of your success here. Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts and the networks ZS supports to assist our ZSers in cultivating community spaces, obtaining the resources they need to thrive, and sharing the messages they are passionate about.  


**ZS's Business Consulting group** partners with clients to design and deliver solutions to help them tackle a broad range of business challenges. Our teams work on multiple projects simultaneously, leveraging advanced data analytics and problem-solving techniques. Our recommendations and solutions are based on rigorous research and analysis underpinned by deep expertise and thought leadership. **STRATEGY INSIGHTS & PLANNING ASSOCIATE**  

Strategy Insights & Planning Associates (SIPAs) create and deliver solutions for our project teams. SIPAs leverage their analytic, synthesis and communication skills to derive insights and analyze business problems. In particular, SIPAs collaborate with their project team to apply problem-solving frameworks to client issues, and employ standard analytic techniques to help guide the project team with client decisions. **What You'll Do:*** Leverage problem-solving skills and frameworks to help develop solutions to client business problems
* Support market research and/or desk research to derive insights and inform client decision making
* Design custom analyses for internal review using tools like Excel, Access, Confirmit and ZS's proprietary software
* Synthesize and communicate results to ZS teams through oral and written presentations for communication to clients
* Collaborate with ZS teams to implement solutions for the client
* Directly support project deliverables
* Support the execution of the project plan developed and designed by the team
* Perform quality checks and assist in driving the project forward

 **What You'll Bring:*** Bachelor's or master's degree in a field with quantitative coursework such as business, economics, marketing, psychology, physical or life sciences. A demonstrated record of academic success is required.
* Up to 3 years of relevant post-collegiate job experience, preferably gathering and analyzing qualitative or quantitative data
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
* High motivation, good work ethic, maturity and personal initiative
* Effective oral and written communication skills
* Empathy, adaptability and emotional intelligence
* Attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset
* Self-discipline for planning and organizing tasks
* Aptitude for, and enjoyment of, working in teams


**Perks & Benefits:**
ZS offers a comprehensive total rewards package including health and well-being, financial planning, annual leave, personal growth and professional development. Our robust skills development programs, multiple career progression options and internal mobility paths and collaborative culture empowers you to thrive as an individual and global team member.

  

We are committed to giving our employees a flexible and connected way of working. A flexible and connected ZS allows us to combine work from home and on-site presence at clients/ZS offices for the majority of our week. The magic of ZS culture and innovation thrives in both planned and spontaneous face-to-face connections.

**Considering applying?**
At ZS, we're building a diverse and inclusive company where people bring their passions to inspire life-changing impact in global healthcare and beyond. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and recognize the value that candidates with all backgrounds, including non-traditional ones, bring. If you are interested in joining us, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements listed above.  

ZS is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment and advancement opportunities without regard to any class protected by applicable law. **To Complete Your Application:**
Candidates must possess work authorization for their intended country of employment.
An on-line application, including a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required
to be considered.  

NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.
company_description: ZS is a management consulting and technology firm focused on transforming global healthcare and beyond. We leverage leading-edge analytics, data and science to help clients make intelligent decisions.

title: Construction Manager
description:
**Description**  



  

This position is eligible for telework, which is currently available one day per week. New hires are eligible to apply 30 days after their effective date of hire.

  

JOB TITLE:

  

Construction Manager

  

AGENCY:

  

Construction & Development

  

DEPT/DIV:

  

Delivery/MNR

  

REPORTS TO:

  

Senior Director Construction

  

WORK LOCATION:

  

420 Lexington Ave

  

HOURS OF WORK:

  

9:00 AM to 5:30 AM or as required (7.5HR/DAY)

  

HAY POINTS:

  

611

  

SALARY RANGE:

  

$90,908 to $119,317

  

DEADLINE:

  

Open Until Filled

  

Summary

  

The Construction Manager will manage MTA Construction and Development efforts related to contract compliance, ensuring the safe and effective delivery of major capital projects on schedule and within budget. Responsible for ensuring successful project execution in conformance with requirements of the approved design and contract documents, applicable criteria and standards, and requirements of the MTA operating agency clients.

  

Responsibilities


Lead construction management team in effective execution of the construction management process, including management and oversight of contractor performance, construction activities, contract administration, and inspection services through completion of the project life-cycle.

  

Reviews in-house technical designs for constructability in non-design-build projects.

  

Responsible for monitoring and auditing third-party technical design and construction activities for compliance with the contract’s requirements.

  

Oversee multi-disciplinary construction team, ensuring that quality projects are effectively and efficiently delivered within established schedule and budget and that appropriate project documentation is maintained.

  

Ensure project delivery follows all contract documentation, applicable standards, guidelines, laws, regulations, codes, policies, procedures, and project requirements of the MTA operating agency clients.

  

Ensure that safety is an integral part of all construction activities.

  

Responsible for developing solutions to unforeseen conditions. In coordination with Contracts, negotiate change orders as required.

  



Work with Delivery staff to incorporate revisions to plans and guidelines as needed.

  

In coordination with the Delivery Services Office, manage the adoption of innovative methods, processes, and procedures to ensure effective and efficient project delivery with quality outcomes.

  

Oversee construction team participation in constructability, project alternatives, feasibility, cost-benefit, risk, and life-cycle cost analyses and studies.

  



Participate in pre-construction project planning as needed.

  

Manage development and preparation of detailed project status reporting, presentations, and updates to related systems.

  

Responsible for construction team role in project support activities such as coordination of owner support/force account services and capital payments.

  

Develop and maintain productive and transparent relationships with all relevant stakeholders, including MTA operating agency clients.

  



Ensure effective communication on project status and timely resolution of issues.

  

Manage selection, development, and motivation of personnel.

  



Ensure prompt and effective coaching, counseling, and career development for subordinates.

  

Responsible for reviewing staff performance and disciplining/terminating employees when necessary.

  



Create a professional environment that respects individual differences and enables all employees to develop and contribute to their full potential.

  

Perform other duties as assigned.

  

Education and Experience

  

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Architecture, Construction or Project Management, Business Administration, Transportation, or a related field.

  



Must have a minimum of five (5) years of related experience.

  



Competencies:

  



Licensed Professional Engineer or Registered Architect desirable.  



  

PMP and CCM Certifications are preferred.

  

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

  



Must have focus and ability to deliver results, organizational effectiveness, and continuous improvement.

  



Must possess excellent team-building, listening, problem-solving, and prioritization skills.

  



Proficient computer skills (i.e., Windows environment, Microsoft Office, PeopleSoft, Oracle, etc.) and strong business administrative skills (i.e., presentations, report and letter writing, time management, etc.).

  

Other Information


Pursuant to the New York State Public Officers Law & the MTA Code of Ethics, all employees who hold a policymaking position must file an Annual Statement of Financial Disclosure (FDS) with the NYS Commission on Ethics and Lobbying in Government (the “Commission”).


Selection Criteria


Based on evaluation of education, skills, experience, and interview.

  

How to Apply


MTA employees must apply via My MTA Portal. You can submit an online application by logging into My MTA Portal, clicking the My Job Search ribbon, and selecting the “Careers” link. Logging in through My MTA Portal will link your BSC ID number to your job application to identify you as an internal applicant.


Equal Employment Opportunity


MTA and its subsidiary and affiliated agencies are equal opportunity employers, including those with respect to veteran status and individuals with disabilities.

  

The MTA encourages qualified applicants from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and abilities, including military service members, to apply.

title: VP of Older Adult Services and Economic Development
description:
Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of older adults and driving economic development initiatives? As Elmcor's VP of Older Adult Services and Economic Development, you will have the opportunity to lead impactful programs that directly benefit our community. You will play a key role in developing strategies to support older adults' well-being while spearheading initiatives to boost economic growth in Corona, NY. You will be given great benefits such as Medical, Dental, and Vision. Join us in this exciting role that offers a competitive salary of **$125,000** and the chance to apply your expertise to drive positive change in our community.

### **MAKE A DIFFERENCE AS A VP OF OLDER ADULT SERVICES AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT**


As the VP of Older Adult Services and Economic Development at Elmcor, you will report directly to the Chief Program Officer and play a pivotal role in the senior leadership team. Your responsibilities will include translating the agency's strategic vision into actionable plans, overseeing program success, and evaluating program effectiveness to enhance participant outcomes. Leading a team of dedicated professionals, including the Assistant Director and Program Coordinators, you will drive service delivery excellence to ensure optimal results and sustainable funding diversification.

### **ARE YOU THE VP OF OLDER ADULT SERVICES AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT WE'RE LOOKING FOR?**


The successful candidate for the VP of Older Adult Services and Economic Development position at Elmcor will possess a Bachelor's degree (Master's degree preferred) in Human Services, Social Sciences, Public Health, Business/Public Administration, or a related field. A minimum of five years of leadership experience in a nonprofit, government, or philanthropy setting overseeing multiple programs is required, ideally within an organization serving diverse communities. Key skills include demonstrated accomplishments in senior management, effective team leadership, commitment to social justice principles, program development and management expertise, strategic thinking, strong communication skills, budget and grant management proficiency, ability to analyze complex data, and a high level of professionalism and confidentiality. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in building and managing effective teams, implementing anti-racism principles, mentoring management staff, and connecting programs to organizational goals. This role requires sound judgment, the ability to manage competing priorities, and a collaborative approach to team dynamics and organizational culture.

**Knowledge and skills required for the position are:**

* Demonstrated accomplishments in a senior management role with a proven track record in building and managing effective teams.
* Demonstrated commitment to the principles of anti-racism and human justice and experience in implementing these principles in program areas.
* Effective team leadership and managing change skills while balancing competing priorities strongly desired.
* Demonstrated ability to mentor and coach management staff members and coordinate between multiple programmatic areas.
* Demonstrated commitment to working for social justice reduction of health disparities and racial equity.
* Experience in program development and management and have a sophisticated understanding of and interest in Elmcor's older adult and economic development public policy and program areas.
* A strategic mindset and ability to connect programs to organizational goals and outcomes.
* Proven results leveraging available resources effectively to meet program objectives and exceptional program
* budgetand grant management skills.
* Ability to exercise sound judgment make timely decisions and advise staff on multiple projects priorities and deadlines while providing timely comprehensive feedback.
* Possess a proven ability to work collaboratively as part of a team and an interest in building a strong organizational culture.
* Display excellent and versatile oral and written communications skills including the ability to summarize detailed information.
* Demonstrated ability to analyze and compile complex data for planning and reporting purposes.
* Demonstrate an ability to demonstrate respect professionalism and sound judgment clearly and consistently with all people.
* Exercise high and strict levels of confidentiality and use professional judgment and discretion.

**Education and/or Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree required; Master's degree preferred in Human Services,Social Sciences,Public Health Business/Public Administration or a related field is strongly desired
* A minimum of five years leadership experience in a nonprofit,government or philanthropy overseeing multiple programs or contracts ideally at an organization serving diverse communities.

### **GET STARTED WITH OUR TEAM!**

### **IF YOU CAN MEET THESE REQUIREMENTS AND PERFORM THIS JOB AS DESCRIBED ABOVE, WE WOULD BE HAPPY TO HAVE YOU AS PART OF OUR TEAM!**

title: Residential Counselor (CASAC)
description:
**Job Title**: Residential Counselor

**Location**: Corona (Queens), NY

**Salary**: 52,000 - 55,000

**Type:** Full-time

**Benefits**: Yes

 **Job breakdown**


Even though substance abuse and mental health disorders transcend language and cultural barriers, language differences often block a person from accessing proper care and, ultimately, the opportunity for a fulfilling and complete life. Our client has multiple openings in Queens for addiction counselor roles.

**What you will own**

* Completes intake process and arrives at treatment recommendations and level of care decisions that are  

appropriate to the client's level of functioning and medical necessity.
* Completes psychosocial assessments.
* Develops initial and comprehensive individualized treatment plans based on client's needs, using  

client's words, and that have measurable objectives within established timelines, based on assessment,  

psychosocial, client's assessed stage of change, and in consultation with the client and treatment team as  

appropriate.
* Provides individual counseling based on treatment plans and client-centered needs.
* Conducts group counseling.
* Conducts evidence-based practices to the individual needs of the clients (EBPs include, but are not  

limited to, Cognitive Behavior Therapy, Motivational Interviewing, Matrix Model, Trauma Focused  

Cognitive Behavioral Therapy).
* Responds to client feedback/suggestions.
* Is responsible for verification of employment and timely and accurate collection of pay stubs and client  

fees.
* Monitors client's savings.
* Conducts discharge planning with the client.

 **Skills you will bring to the table**

* Knowledge of evidence-based practice model of treatment (MI, CBT, CRAFT, etc.)
* Team mindset
* Ability to stay calm in a crisis
* Strong interpersonal communication (written and spoken)
* Culturally sensitive and empathetic
* Proficient computer skills (Word, Outlook, etc.)
* Flexibility in weekend shift coverage or swap
* Familiarity with electronic documentation programs

**Non-negotiables**

* CASAC and 1 year experience working with applicable populations who have substance abuse/co-  

occurring disorders; or
* CASAC-T with 2-3 years' experience working with applicable populations who have substance  

abuse/co-occurring disorders; or
* HS Diploma and 6 years' experience working with applicable populations who have substance abuse/co-  

occurring disorders.
* Must have computer skills.
* Must successfully complete a criminal background check, obtain clearance from the Office of Children  

and Family Services and be drug free.
* Must be open to working any shift when given a month notice

  

#CASAC-T #NYnonprofitjobs #addiction #CASAC #Queens #Elmcor #recovery #NYjobs #Queensjobs

description:
**Accounts Payable Coordinator (Temp Position)**

At Fitness and Wellness, we are dedicated to promoting health and well-being through our state-of-the-art facilities and exceptional service. With 9 locations across New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and New York, our mission is to provide our members with the best in fitness and wellness. We are currently seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Temporary Accounts Payable Coordinator to join our dynamic administration team.

As a Temporary Accounts Payable Coordinator, you will play a vital role in our financial operations. This position offers an excellent opportunity to contribute to the success of our organization by ensuring accurate and timely processing of payments, managing vendor relationships, and supporting the overall efficiency of our accounting department. If you have a keen eye for detail, a passion for numbers, and a desire to work in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

title: Landscape Architect (5-10 years)
description:
\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_**Discover your passion with FPA**


At French & Parrello Associates(FPA), we are looking for talented and driven individuals committed to providing innovative solutions that improve our world. We are seeking to grow with individuals who are passionate about their work, who are committed to delivering quality service, and who are eager to learn and grow professionally.


We value candidates of all backgrounds, skill sets, and experiences. At FPA, we actively promote a culture of inclusion and diversity and our employees are part of a dynamic and collaborative work environment where they are encouraged to share ideas, take on new challenges, and contribute to the success of the company.


From its inception, FPA has been dedicated to providing practical solutions to complex problems. Through its diverse team of professionals, FPA is capable of blending the practical aspects of project implementation into creative design solutions. As an FPA employee, you will have the opportunity to grow your career, working alongside dedicated professionals on exciting projects. If you are a motivated individual looking for an exciting and rewarding career opportunity, we encourage you to apply to be a part of our energetic team.

**About This Opportunity**


FPA is currently searching for a full-time **Landscape Architect** at our **Wall Township, New Jersey Office**. The ideal candidate will have 5 to 10 years’ experience in Landscape Architecture.


At FPA, our unwavering commitment to dedicated service and innovative solutions has empowered us to build thriving communities and expand our horizons. The ideal candidate will work with talented engineers from various disciplines, collaborating to design, develop, and deliver projects that improve people's lives. They will bring a fresh perspective, a passion for engineering, and a commitment to excellence. Joining our team will provide you with an excellent opportunity to unlock your full potential, gain invaluable experience, and create a meaningful impact on the world.


Core Responsibilities

* Computer literate in ACAD Civil 3D, Word, Excel, Publisher, Bluebeam, etc.
* Good hand and computer rendering skills
* Working knowledge of plant material present in the New Jersey Region a must.
* Creative, able to assist in many areas, a team player, and able to diversify in work assignments.
* ***This job description is not all inclusive of all duties. Other duties may be assigned.***

**What We Are Looking For**  

Required Qualifications

* 5-10 years of architectural experience
* BA or BS in Landscape Architecture
* ***When applying please submit your portfolio samples.***

**Compensation and Benefits:**


As a valued member of our team, we provide you with a flexible benefits package that reflects our respect for your workplace contributions, professional goals, and personal priorities. FPA offers an extensive range of benefits, including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings, aimed at ensuring the physical well-being and financial security of employees throughout their careers. The personal benefits program at FPA includes the following:

* Medical, Dental, Vision insurance
* 401(k) Retirement Plan with Employer Matching & Roth 401(k) Option
* Individual and Dependent Life Insurance
* Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance and Supplemental Insurance Plans
* Employee Assistance Program(EAP) and Wellness Benefits
* Tuition Reimbursement

* Corporate sponsored events, outings & activities, including community outreach opportunities

**About FPA**


Since 1974, French & Parrello Associates (FPA) has partnered with clients to address the ever-changing challenges of the world around us. Nationally and locally ranked among Engineering News - Record’s Top Firms, FPA has the staff and resources to provide innovative engineering services to clients in both the public and private sectors across a growing network of locations in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, and Georgia. From modernizing the aging infrastructure, to designing state-of-the-art facilities and serving as stewards to our environment, FPA improves quality of life.


At our core, we are a dedicated group of professionals focused on servicing our clients and improving our world. title: CAD Manager
description:
**CAD Manager**  

Full Time | Wall Township, NJ, US


\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_ **Who We Are**  

At FPA, we are looking for talented and driven professionals to join our commitment to pushing the boundaries of what is possible and providing cutting-edge solutions that make a difference in people's lives. We value individuals who are passionate about their work, who are committed to delivering quality results, and who are eager to learn and grow with us.  

We value candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, skill sets, and walks of life. At FPA, we actively foster a work environment that promotes inclusion and diversity, which is embedded in the foundation of our practice through policies, training, local partnerships with professional and diverse organizations, internal networks, and leadership support. We offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment where employees are encouraged to share ideas, take on new challenges, and contribute to the success of the company.  

As an FPA employee, you will have the opportunity to achieve anything you set your mind to, and to help shape the future. If you are a motivated individual who is looking for an exciting and rewarding career opportunity, we encourage you to apply to be a part of a dynamic and inclusive community of professionals. **This Opportunity**  

FPA is currently seeking a full-time CADD Manager based at our Wall Township, NJ headquarters. We are in search of a dynamic leader to spearhead our Computer-Aided Design and Drafting (CADD) initiatives. As we raise the standards for engineering excellence, we invite you to play a pivotal role in our journey. This critical position will report directly to a Senior Vice President.

**Core Responsibilities**  

* Lead FPA’s CAD management, driving drafting standards, development of details library, hardware/software/network evaluations, data maintenance, procedures, and training.
* Advance procedures that integrate the latest standards and equip designers, engineers, and newcomers with the skills they need to excel.
* Develop and maintain CADD standards that meet and exceed the requirements of agencies across our client base.
* Collaborate with our Technical Departments to craft High Quality Drawings and CAD QA procedures that ensure project perfection.
* Develop training program for interns, new hires, and existing staff to empower users in all aspects of CAD.
* Keep our standards at the forefront of the industry by continually developing and maintaining CADD standards for our client base, including NJDOT, DELDOT, PA Turnpike, and PENNDOT.
* Oversee procurement, management, and optimization of appropriate software licensure.
* Navigate through the complex terrain of geospatial data, expertly interpreting various forms including Aerial Imagery and GIS topography data. All this is done using ArcMap (ArcGIS) to craft engineering-related projects with precision.
* Provide unrelenting support through software testing and troubleshooting for our engineering design & CADD programs. Keep a vigilant log of common troubleshooting issues.
* Be the guardian of compliance by reviewing CADD drawings for adherence to standards and requirements, whether they come in hard copy or electronic form.
* Step in as the primary point of contact for end-users seeking assistance with software, project workflows, and design technical issues.
* Collaborate closely with Project Managers and discipline leads to assign CADD standards to projects, ensuring high quality and milestones met.
* Uphold, develop, and reinforce all CADD standards for our company and clients, ensuring project success is non-negotiable.
* Specialize in all elements of design using the latest technology, including Autodesk, Revit, Civil 3D, Microstation, Inroads, Navisworks, and Projectwise.
* Bring your expert counsel to management on program implementation, equipment needs, and the evolution of technological and support strategies.
* Share your technical expertise, knowledge, and support with departmental divisions and other departments, ensuring the harmony of engineering and design support activities.

 **Required Qualifications**  

* 15 plus years of experience in CADD management within the field of consulting engineering/architecture.
* Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Architecture, or a related field is a plus, but not mandatory.
* Proficiency in CAD software, including AutoCAD, Civil 3D, Revit, ArcGIS, and MicroStation.
* A charismatic leader with unparalleled training and leadership skills.
* A profound understanding of engineering principles.
* Familiarity with DOT standards and regulations.
* Exceptional communication skills and a knack for innovative problem-solving.
* Extraordinary organizational and project management skills.

 **Compensation and Benefits**  

As a valued member of our team, we provide you with a flexible benefits package that reflects our respect for your workplace contributions, professional goals, and personal priorities. FPA offers an extensive range of benefits, including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings, aimed at ensuring the physical well-being and financial security of employees throughout their careers. The personal benefits program at FPA includes the following:  

* Medical, Dental, Vision insurance
* 401(k) Retirement Plan with Employer Matching
* Roth 401(k) Option
* Individual and Dependent Life Insurance
* Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance
* Health Wellness Programs, Flu shots, Rewards for Healthy Lifestyle
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Training and Professional Development
* Opportunities for Community Outreach Through Internal Networks
* Personal Time Off Program (PTO)
* Transit/Parking Program
* Flexible Summer Work Schedules
* Aflac
* Discount Tickets: Tickets At Work, LifeMart, and Staples Work Wins
* Credit Union

* Dry Cleaning Service
* Corporate Events, Outings & Activities
