title: Assembly Technician
description:
**JOB TITLE:** Assembly Technician


**LOCATION:** Hawthorne, NY (on-site)


**TYPE**: Full time, regular


**COMPENSATION**: $19/hr - $21/hr


Clarapath is a medical robotics company based in Westchester County, NY. Our mission is to transform and modernize laboratory workflows with the goal of improving patient care, decreasing costs, and enhancing the quality and consistency of laboratory processes. SectionStar™ by Clarapath is a ground-breaking automated system designed to be used in histology laboratories by trained personnel to section cell and tissue samples and transfer those sections to glass slides for a pathologist to review. These samples are used to diagnose cancer or autoimmune disorders, and are vitally important in determining treatment plans and patient outcomes. Through the use of innovative technology, data and precision analytics Clarapath is paving the way for a new era of laboratory medicine.


**Role Summary**:


The **Assembly Technician** will be working on medical device development and integration as part of a tight knit team. This role is multi-disciplinary with responsibility for assembling our consumable subassemblies as well as supporting our 3-D printing process. The ideal candidate should be detail-oriented and a team player, willing to pitch in on the manufacturing floor when needed.


**Responsibilities***:*

* Assemble parts and components according to specifications from work instructions
* Prepare work to be accomplished by studying parts lists and gathering parts, subassemblies, tools and materials
* Use hand tools to assemble parts, as needed
* Conduct quality control checks on the assembled parts in order to ensure compliance with specifications
* Maintain cleanliness and orderliness in work area
* Post-process 3-D printed parts after printing by cleaning, trimming, sanding or applying other finishing techniques
* Collaborate with engineers, other team members and supervisors to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve issues related to product assembly
* Adhere to all company policies and procedures, including those related to safety, quality, and regulatory compliance
* Perform additional assembly tasks and pitch in on manufacturing floor as needed


**Qualifications***:*

* High school diploma or equivalent required
* Attention to detail
* Excellent hand-eye coordination
* Ability to read, interpret and follow internal work instructions and specifications
* Familiarity with basic tools used in production processes
* Willing to perform repetitive tasks while sitting or standing for extended periods of time
* Effective communication skills and ability to work well in a team environment
* Flexibility to work in fast-paced environment and adapt to changing project requirements


**Company Offers:**


* Competitive salary, commensurate with experience and education
* A collaborative and diverse work environment where our teams thrive on solving complex challenges
* A mission driven organization where every team member will be responsible for changing the standards of delivering healthcare


*Clarapath is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, Clarapath complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.*

title: Literacy Instructional Coach
description:
Generation Ready has proudly been a national provider of professional learning in schools around the country for over 30 years, and in particular has maintained a market leading presence in the New York City education system. Our job-embedded approach creates meaningful partnerships in classrooms and is underpinned by instructional support that is always customized based on the needs of the districts, schools, and/or teachers that we’re working with. At the heart of every engagement is our philosophy that developing educator capacity is the most impactful tool in raising student achievement.

Our best-in-class team of consultants have a breadth of knowledge and experience in various key content areas and are consistently driving thoroughly researched and rigorous instructional practices. Generation Ready is currently seeking coaches with expertise in literacy, math, STEM, and special education, across K-12, to join our dynamic and growing team as we continue to provide critical support to schools in the NYC metropolitan area.

Coaches are expected to work onsite in the following capacities:

* Collaborate with stakeholders at all levels, including department of education, district, and school levels, to develop a customized professional learning plan based on the needs of each underlying classroom
* Engage in side-by-side coaching, including conducting lesson modeling, to build capacity in excellent standards-based instruction
* Lead teachers in reflective practices, data analysis, and examination of student work to improve pedagogy and develop dynamic protocols
* Support school leaders in assessing and adapting frameworks and communication to foster a collaborative environment focused on student success
* Foster thoughtful relationships with partners to ensure seamless communication and real-time feedback cycles to ensure all needs are being met

Ideal candidates will have:

* A minimum of 10 years education experience, ideally including some combination of teaching, school leadership, coaching and/or educational program development
* A thorough understanding of cross-content trends, shifts, standards, and methodologies
* Experience working in urban schools and with diverse student populations
* Expertise in various types of high-quality instructional materials
* A demonstrated ability to engage with stakeholders and develop relationships
* Willingness to participate in ongoing personal, professional learning
* A highly organized and process driven focus

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Experience:

* classroom teaching: 10 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Cheesemonger
description:
**Greene Grape Provisions is Not Your Average Grocer…**

**We are a neighborhood grocer deeply rooted in the Fort Greene community and the community we have created through our customers, employees, vendors and friends. In 2008, Greene Grape Provisions in Fort Greene, Brooklyn was opened to feature high quality, sustainable food with an emphasis placed on sourcing locally wherever possible. A one stop shop for our neighborhood's cooking needs, our mission is to provide for everyday food made with integrity, skill and pride.**

**The cheese program at Greene Grape Provisions is one of the most reputable in NYC, boasting over 250 unique cheeses and charcuterie items from all over the world. Our approach to selling cheese is to offer our customers the best quality artisan products, in an approachable and educational environment that is welcoming to everyone. Our sourcing practices emphasize “real” cheeses that are a true expression of their environment, and promote products that are in line with the Slow Food tenets of “good, clean, and fair”. Our cheese case is composed mostly of American artisanal cheeses, supplemented by a curated selection of iconic European cheeses. We offer training that highlights the unique history of each cheese, and the importance of respecting the product through proper cutting techniques, regular case maintenance, and daily cheese care. Greene Grape Cheesemongers are also provided with many networking and learning opportunities to help further your education and passion for cheese!**

\\*  
Key responsibilities:

* Cut and wrap cheese and charcuterie to order and for grab & go case
* Pack out and stock all cheeses, jams, honeys, dried fruits and nuts and other accoutrements
* Make fresh mozzarella daily for retail sale and in house production
* Keep all cases fully stocked and abundant at all times, utilizing FIFO
* Perform daily quality control on all products, keeping them attractive and in good condition
* Maintain food safety and sanitation standards as defined by the DOA at all times
* Accurately receive and record deliveries, keeping storage areas organized
* Provide excellent customer service with in-depth knowledge of all products sold at the counter
* Cut and wrap cheese to order for online sales and assist with catering platters
* Keep the beer fridge and floor displays fully stocked and abundant at all times
* Maintain accurate and attractive signage for all items
* Communicate with Cheese Manager when equipment needs to be ordered and serviced
* Assist in providing content for social media in collaboration with the Marketing Department
* Work as a team with other departments and counters to provide assistance when needed
* Assist with accurate and timely quarterly inventory counts as designated by the General Manager
* Attend annual all staff meeting as well as any staff classes or tastings of new products

\\*  
\\*  
Requirements:

* Passion for cheese and charcuterie with a focus on excellent customer service
* Ability to work on your feet for 8+ hours, walk up/down stairs, and lift up to 50 lbs unassisted
* Detail oriented with an ability to multitask under pressure
* Available to work weekends, evenings, and holidays
* A strong work ethic & positive attitude with a desire to taste and learn!

\\*  
\\*  
Benefits & Compensation:

* Compensation $16-$20 per hour based on level of experience
* Medical, Dental & Vision health care packages available
* Generous discounts at Greene Grape businesses 2 weeks paid vacation/sick leave accrued on an hourly basis
* Pre-tax transit spending benefits
* Generous community fridge and pantry with overflow of product available to all staff

\\*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $16.00 - $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Holidays
* Morning shift
* Night shift
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY 11217: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person
